member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Client.NativeProxy.CompareTo(ShellBoost.Core.Client.NativeProxy)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.
member.param: An object to compare with this instance.
member.returns: A value that indicates the relative order of the objects being compared. The return value has these meanings: Value Meaning Less than zero This instance precedes in the sort order. Zero This instance occurs in the same position in the sort order as . Greater than zero This instance follows in the sort order.

member.summary: The platform clears the placeholder’s in-sync state upon a successful call.

member.summary: The platform sets the placeholder’s in-sync state upon a successful call.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PIN_STATE.SB_PIN_STATE_UNSPECIFIED
member.summary: The platform can decide freely when the placeholder’s content needs to present or absent locally on the disk.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PIN_STATE.SB_PIN_STATE_PINNED
member.summary: The sync provider will be notified to fetch the placeholder’s content asynchronously after the pin request is received by the platform.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PIN_STATE.SB_PIN_STATE_UNPINNED
member.summary: The sync provider will be notified to dehydrate/invalidate the placeholder’s content on-disk asynchronously after the unpin request is received by the platform.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PIN_STATE.SB_PIN_STATE_EXCLUDED
member.summary: the placeholder will never be synced to the cloud by the sync provider.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PIN_STATE.SB_PIN_STATE_INHERIT
member.summary: The platform treats it as if the caller performs a move operation on the placeholder and hence re-evaluates the placeholder’s pin state based on its parent’s pin state.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE
member.summary: Defines the state of a placeholder file or folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE_NO_STATES
member.summary: When returned, the file or directory is not a placeholder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE_PLACEHOLDER
member.summary: The file or directory is a placeholder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE_SYNC_ROOT
member.summary: The directory is both a placeholder directory as well as the sync root.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE_ESSENTIAL_PROP_PRESENT
member.summary: The file or directory must be a placeholder and there exists an essential property in the property store of the file or directory.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE_IN_SYNC
member.summary: The file or directory must be a placeholder and its content in sync with the cloud.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE_PARTIAL
member.summary: The file or directory must be a placeholder and its content is not ready to be consumed by the user application, though it may or may not be fully present locally.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE_PARTIALLY_ON_DISK
member.summary: The file or directory must be a placeholder and its content is not fully present locally. When this is set, CF_PLACEHOLDER_STATE_PARTIAL must also be set.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Ipc.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE.SB_PLACEHOLDER_STATE_INVALID
member.summary: This is an invalid state. The API fails to parse the information of the file or directory.

member.summary: Gets the text currently entered in the dialog's File name edit box. The text in the File name edit box does not necessarily reflect the item the user chose. To get the item the user chose, use the ResultsIdLists or ResultsIdList properties.

member.summary: The context is a Folder Picker dialog. This is only valid for Common Dialog boxes.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType
member.summary: Defines a file dialog event type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.FileOk
member.summary: Called just before the dialog is about to return with a result. Corresponds to IFileDialogEvents::OnFileOk event. This will only be sent if the common dialog box state and/or results have been successfully validated.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.FolderChange
member.summary: Called when the user navigates to a new folder. Corresponds to IFileDialogEvents::OnFolderChange event.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.FolderChanging
member.summary: Called before FolderChange. This allows the implementer to stop navigation to a particular location. Corresponds to IFileDialogEvents::OnFolderChanging event.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.Overwrite
member.summary: Called from the save dialog when the user chooses to overwrite a file. Corresponds to IFileDialogEvents::OnOverwrite event.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.SelectionChange
member.summary: Called when the user changes the selection in the dialog's view. Corresponds to IFileDialogEvents::OnSelectionChange event.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.ShareViolation
member.summary: Enables an application to respond to sharing violations that arise from Open or Save operations. Corresponds to IFileDialogEvents::OnShareViolation event.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.TypeChange
member.summary: Called when the dialog is opened to notify the application of the initial chosen filetype. Corresponds to IFileDialogEvents::OnTypeChange event.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.OnButtonOk
member.summary: Called when the default button is pressed. Only raised if Common Dialog hooks are enabled.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.OnButtonCancel
member.summary: Called when the cancel button is pressed. Only raised if Common Dialog hooks are enabled.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.OnClosed
member.summary: Called when the native window is closed or destroyed. Only raised if hooks are enabled.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.FileDialogEventType.OnOpened
member.summary: Called when ShellBoost starts monitoring a native window. Only raised if hooks are enabled. Note that if any dialog box hooks are enabled, this event can be raised twice.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystemProvider.GetItem(System.String)
member.summary: Gets an item using its relative path. This method should be overriden for optimal performance.
member.param: A string specifying the path, relative to the virtualization root, to the file or directory to be deleted.
member.returns: An instance of a ProjectedFileSystemItem class or null if the item was not found.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystemProvider.EnumerateItems(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Enumerates the item under the relative path.
member.param: A string specifying the path, relative to the virtualization root, to the file or directory to be deleted.

Gets the search expression. The search expression may include wildcard characters. The provider should use the ProjectedFileSystem's DoesNameContainWildCards function to determine whether wildcards are present in searchExpression, and it should use the DoesFileNameMatch function to determine whether an entry in its backing store matches a search expression containing wildcards.
member.returns: A list of items corresponding to the input arguments.

member.summary: Starts the Projected File System, making it available to service I/O and invoke callbacks on this provider instance.
member.param: A string specifying the full path to the virtualization root.

member.summary: The state cannot be determined.

member.summary: The item is a placeholder. The PRJ_FILE_STATE_FULL and PRJ_FILE_STATE_TOMBSTONE bits will not appear in combination with each other or any other bit.

member.summary: The placeholder item's metadata has been modified.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION
member.summary: A notification value specified when sending the notification in a callback. Maps to Windows' PRJ_NOTIFICATION enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_OPENED
member.summary: If received in a notification: indicates that a handle has been created to an existing file or folder, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when a handle is created to an existing file or folder. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified if any further handles are created to the file or folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_NEW_FILE_CREATED
member.summary: If received in a notification: a new file or folder has been created, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. If specified on virtualization instance start: the provider should be notified when a new file or folder is created. If specified in response to a notification: no effect.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_OVERWRITTEN
member.summary: If received in a notification: an existing file has been overwritten or superceded, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when an existing when an existing file is overwritten or superceded. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when the file or folder is overwritten or superceded.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_PRE_DELETE
member.summary: If received in a notification: a file or folder is about to be deleted. If the provider returns an error code from the callback, the delete will not take effect. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder is about to be deleted. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder is about to be deleted.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_PRE_RENAME
member.summary: If received in a notification: a file or folder is about to be renamed. If the provider returns an error code from the callback, the rename will not take effect. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder is about to be renamed. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder is about to be renamed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_PRE_SET_HARDLINK
member.summary: If received in a notification: a hard link is about to be created for the file. If the provider returns an error code from the callback, the hard link operation will not take effect. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified when a hard link is about to be created for a file. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when a hard link is about to be created for a file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_RENAMED
member.summary: If received in a notification: indicates that a file/folder has been renamed. The file/folder may have been moved into the virtualization instance. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified that a file or folder has been renamed. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified when a file or folder has been renamed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_HARDLINK_CREATED
member.summary: If received in a notification: indicates that a hard link has been created for the file. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that the provider should be notified that a hard link has been created for a file. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified that a hard link has been created for the file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_HANDLE_CLOSED_NO_MODIFICATION
member.summary: If received in a notification: a handle has been closed on the file/folder, and the file’s content was not modified while the handle was open, and the file/folder was not deleted If specified on virtualization instance start: yhe provider should be notified when a handle is closed on a file/folder and the closing handle neither modified nor deleted it. If specified in response to a notification: yhe provider should be notified when handles are closed for the file/folder and there were no modifications or deletions associated with the closing handle.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_HANDLE_CLOSED_FILE_MODIFIED
member.summary: If received in a notification: a handle has been closed on the file, and that the file’s content was modified while the handle was open. If specified on virtualization instance start: the provider should be notified when a handle is closed on a file/folder and the closing handle was used to modify it. If specified in response to a notification: the provider should be notified when a handle is closed on the file/folder and the closing handle was used to modify it.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_HANDLE_CLOSED_FILE_DELETED
member.summary: If received in a notification: a handle has been closed on the file/folder, and that it was deleted as part of closing the handle. If specified on virtualization instance start: the provider should be notified when a handle is closed on a file/folder and it is deleted as part of closing the handle. If specified in response to a notification: the provider should be notified when a handle is closed on the file/folder and it is deleted as part of closing the handle.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFICATION.PRJ_NOTIFICATION_FILE_PRE_CONVERT_TO_FULL
member.summary: If received in a notification: the file is about to be expanded from a placeholder to a full file, i.e. its contents are likely to be modified. If the provider returns an error code from the callback, the file will not be expanded to a full file, and the I/O that triggered the conversion will fail. If there are multiple racing I/Os that would expand the same file, the provider will receive this notification value only once for the file. If specified on virtualization instance start: the provider should be notified when it is about to convert a placeholder to a full file. If specified in response to a notification: the provider should be notified when it is about to convert the placeholder to a full file, assuming it is a placeholder and not already a full file.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFY_TYPES
member.summary: Types of notifications describing a change to the file or folder. Maps to Windows' PRJ_NOTIFICATION enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFY_TYPES.PRJ_NOTIFY_NONE
member.summary: No notification.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFY_TYPES.PRJ_NOTIFY_SUPPRESS_NOTIFICATIONS
member.summary: If received in a notification: this notification value is not sent. If specified on virtualization instance start: indicates that notifications should not be sent for the virtualization instance, or a specified subtree of the instance. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that notifications should not be sent for the specified file or folder until all handles to it are closed.

member.summary: If received in a notification: indicates that a handle has been created to an existing file or folder, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. If specified in response to a notification: indicates that the provider should be notified if any further handles are created to the file or folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_NOTIFY_TYPES.PRJ_NOTIFY_NEW_FILE_CREATED
member.summary: If received in a notification: a new file or folder has been created, the provider can specify a new notification mask for this file or folder when responding to the notification. member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_STARTVIRTUALIZING_FLAGS
member.summary: Flags to provide when starting a virtualization instance. Maps to Windows' PRJ_STARTVIRTUALIZING_FLAGS enumeration..

member.summary: No flags.

member.summary: Specifies that ProjFS should maintain a "negative path cache" for the virtualization instance.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES
member.summary: Descriptions for the reason an update failed. Maps to Windows' PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_NONE
member.summary: The update did not fail.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_DIRTY_METADATA
member.summary: The item was a dirty placeholder (hydrated or not), and the provider did not specify PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_DIRTY_METADATA in PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_DIRTY_DATA
member.summary: The item was a full file and the provider did not specify PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_DIRTY_DATA in PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_TOMBSTONE
member.summary: The item was a tombstone and the provider did not specify PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_TOMBSTONE in PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSES.PRJ_UPDATE_FAILURE_CAUSE_READ_ONLY
member.summary: The item had the DOS read-only bit set and the provider did not specify PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_READ_ONLY in PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES
member.summary: Flags to specify whether updates will be allowed given the state of a file or directory on disk. Maps to Windows' PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_NONE
member.summary: Allow update only if the item is a placeholder (whether hydrated or not).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_DIRTY_METADATA
member.summary: Allow update if the item is a placeholder or a dirty placeholder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_DIRTY_DATA
member.summary: Allow update if the item is a placeholder or if it is a full file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_TOMBSTONE
member.summary: Allow update if the item is a placeholder or if it is a tombstone.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES.PRJ_UPDATE_ALLOW_READ_ONLY
member.summary: Allow update regardless of whether the DOS read-only bit is set on the item.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that receives the enumerated items from the provider. If SearchExpression is not null, the provider must return only those directory entries whose names match the search expression. If SearchExpression is null, the provider must return all directory entries.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.DeleteFile(System.String,ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables a provider to delete an item that has been cached on the local file system.
member.param: A string specifying the path, relative to the virtualization root, to the file or directory to be deleted.
Flags to control the delete operation should be allowed given the state of the file.
if set to true errors may be thrown otherwise the return value may be null.
member.returns: A value that describes the reason for the failure, if any.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.UpdateFileIfNeeded(System.String,ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystemItem,ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.PRJ_UPDATE_TYPES,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables a provider to update an item that has been cached on the local file system.
member.param: A string specifying the path, relative to the virtualization root, to the file or directory to be updated.

The item to update. If the item's VersionInfo.ContentID contains a content identifier that is the same as the content identifier already on the file/directory, the call succeeds and no update takes place. Otherwise, if the call succeeds then the item's VersionInfo.ContentID replaces the existing content identifier on the file.
Flags to control updates. If the item is a dirty placeholder, full file, or tombstone, and the provider does not specify the appropriate flag(s), this routine will fail to update the placeholder.
if set to true errors may be thrown otherwise the return value may be null.
member.returns: A value that describes the reason for the failure, if any.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.ClearNegativePathCache(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Purges the virtualization instance's negative path cache, if it is active.
member.param: if set to true errors may be thrown otherwise the return value may be null.
member.returns: A value that represents the number of paths that were in the cache before it was purged.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.DoesNameCompare(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two file names and returns a value that indicates their relative collation order.
member.param: A string specifying the first name to compare.
A string specifying the second name to compare.
member.returns: A negative value indicates fileName1 is before fileName2 in collation order, zero indicates fileName1 is equal to fileName2, a positive value indicates fileName1 is after fileName2 in collation order

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.DoesNameContainWildCards(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a name contains wildcard characters.
member.param: A string to check for wildcard characters.
member.returns: true if the name contains wildcards; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.DoesFileNameMatch(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a file name matches a search pattern.
member.param: A string of at most MAX_PATH (260) characters specifying the file name to check against pattern.
A string of at most MAX_PATH (260) characters specifying the pattern to compare against the file name.
member.returns: true if the file name matches the pattern; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ProjFS.ProjectedFileSystem.GetOnDiskFileState(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the on-disk file state for a file or directory.
member.remarks: This routine tells the caller what the ProjFS caching state is of the specified file or directory. For example, the caller can use this routine to determine whether the given item is a placeholder or full file. A running provider should be cautious if using this routine on files or directories within one of its virtualization instances, as it may cause callbacks to be invoked in the provider. Depending on the design of the provider this may lead to deadlocks.
member.param: A string specifying the full path to the file whose state is to be queried.
member.returns: A value indicating the state of an item.

member.summary: Sets the CFSTR_FILEDESCRIPTOR and CFSTR_FILECONTENTS formats to an IDataObject. This method may not work completely with data object classes that don't fully implement the native COM IDataObject interface, such as Winforms or WPF ones. If you want to add multiple contents, use the ShellBoost data object created using ShellDataObject.CreateDataObject().
member.param: if set to true streams are transformed into byte arrays before being put in the data object.
if set to true errors may be throw in case of Windows Shell errors.
member.returns: 0 or an error code.

member.param: if set to true use the ChunkedMemoryStream class instead of the MemoryStream class.
if set to true errors may be throw in case of Windows Shell errors.
member.returns: A list of FileStreamDescriptor.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolder.TryParseItem(ShellBoost.Core.ShellBindContext,System.String,System.Int32@,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO@,ShellBoost.Core.ShellItemIdList@)
member.summary: Parses a display name for a Shell Item that may not exist. This method is only implemented for file system Shell Items. It will use the CreateFileSystemItem and CreateFileSystemFolder that you can override if you want it to use your derived classes instead. If you override it, make sure you also override TryGetDisplayName, TryGetAttributes and TryGetPropertyValue in a consistent manner.
member.param: The context corresponding to the original IBindCxt interface.
The number of characters of the display name that was parsed.
Attributes of the virtual item that was parsed.
member.returns: true if parsing was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolder.TryParseItem(System.String,System.Int32@,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO@,ShellBoost.Core.ShellItemIdList@)
member.summary: Parses a display name for a Shell Item that may not exist. This method returns false and is obsolete. You should override TryParseItem with a ShellBindContext parameter instead.
member.param: The number of characters of the display name that was parsed.
Attributes of the virtual item that was parsed.
member.returns: true if parsing was successful, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolder.TryGetDisplayName(ShellBoost.Core.ShellItemIdList,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGDNF,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the display name for a PIDL that may not represent an existing Shell Item. This method is only implemented for file system Shell Items with PIDLs created from the ShellItemIdList.FromFileSystem method. If you override it, make sure you also override TryParseItem, TryGetAttributes and TryGetPropertyValue in a consistent manner.
member.param: Options used to get the name.
member.returns: The display name or null.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolder.TryGetDisplayName(ShellBoost.Core.ShellItemIdList,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets the display name for a PIDL that may not represent an existing Shell Item. This method returns false and is obsolete. You should use or override TryGetDisplayName with a SHGDNF parameter instead.
member.returns: The display name or null.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolder.TryGetAttributes(ShellBoost.Core.ShellItemIdList,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SFGAO@)
member.summary: Gets the attributes for a PIDL that may not represent an existing Shell Item. This method is only implemented for file system Shell Items with PIDLs created from the ShellItemIdList.FromFileSystem method. If you override it, make sure you also override TryParseItem, TryGetDisplayName and TryGetPropertyValue in a consistent manner.
member.returns: The display name or null.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderInitializationOptions.None
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderInitializationOptions.EnumeratesOnlyVisibleColumns
member.summary: Enumerates only the visible columns. Used for the ManageColumns event handling.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderInitializationOptions.NoCommonDialogsHook
member.summary: Disable Common Dialogs Boxes hook. Common Dialog Boxes hooks are only tried in Common Dialog Boxes context. Common Dialog Boxes hooks can fail if the native proxy is not hosted by a Common Dialog Box.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderInitializationOptions.NoContextMenuWrapper
member.summary: Disable Context Menu wrapper. If this is disabled, the ShellMenu items' verbs will not be extracted.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderInitializationOptions.AddSelfToContextMenu
member.summary: Add this folder as an extra input to the Explorer's tree view context menu. Note this may cause duplicate items if these items don't have an associated verb to disambiguate them.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderInitializationOptions.HookAnyParentDialogBox
member.summary: Hook any parent dialog box. By default, the native proxy will only hook parent Common Dialog boxes.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderRegistration

member.summary: Gets the scope of the ShellBoost registration process.

member.summary: Gets or sets the RPC protocol endpoint format. This property value must be consistent with ShellFolderConfiguration's IpcFormat property value.

member.summary: Gets or sets the RPC protocol enumeration batch size. If the value is less or equal to 0, an automatic default value will be used. Note this will not be effective until the client process using the native proxy (for example explorer.exe) is restarted.

member.summary: Gets the server start parameters.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderRegistration.Hide(System.Guid,System.String,ShellBoost.Core.RegistrationMode)
member.summary: Hides the specified Shell Folder. This method uses registry calls.
member.param: The mode. Only User or Machine are supported.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderRegistration.Toggle(System.Guid,System.String,ShellBoost.Core.RegistrationMode)
member.summary: Toggles the specified Shell Folder, shown or hidden. This method uses registry calls.
member.param: The mode. Only User or Machine are supported.
member.returns: true if it's shown, false it it's hidden.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderRegistration.IsShown(System.Guid,System.String,ShellBoost.Core.RegistrationMode)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified Shell Folder is shown or not. This method uses registry calls.
member.param: The mode. Only User or Machine are supported.
member.returns: true if the specified folder class identifier is shown; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderRegistration.GetIsPinnedToNameSpaceTree(System.Guid,ShellBoost.Core.RegistrationMode)
member.summary: Gets a value that determines if the specified Shell Folder is pinned to the name space tree. This method uses registry calls.
member.returns: true if the value is set to 1, false if the value is set to 0, and null if the value is not set.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.ShellFolderRegistration.SetIsPinnedToNameSpaceTree(System.Guid,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},ShellBoost.Core.RegistrationMode)
member.summary: Sets a value that determines if the specified Shell Folder is pinned to the name space tree. This method uses registry calls.
member.param: The new value to set. Null will delete the registry value.
member.returns: The old value, true if it was set to 1, false if it was set to 0, and null if it was not set.

member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandHydrationPolicy
member.summary: Allows a sync provider to control behavior for retrieving data for a placeholder file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandHydrationPolicy.Partial
member.summary: Hydration is performed at the user's request. Hydration does not continue in the background.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandHydrationPolicy.Progressive
member.summary: On demand hydration is performed. If hydration has not finished, it will continue in the background.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandHydrationPolicy.Full
member.summary: Full hydration is performed. Ensures that the placeholder is available locally before completing a request.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandHydrationPolicy.AlwaysFull
member.summary: If this is selected and a placeholder cannot be fully hydrated, the platform will fail with with an ERROR_CLOUD_FILE_INVALID_REQUEST error.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandPopulationPolicy
member.summary: Allows a sync provider to control how a placeholder file or directory.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandPopulationPolicy.Partial
member.summary: If the placefolder files or directories are not fully populated, the platform will request that the sync provider populate only the entries required by the user application. This policy is not currently supported by the platform.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandPopulationPolicy.Full
member.summary: If the placeholder files or directories are not fully populated, the platform will request that the sync provider populate them before completing a user request. This policy is not currently supported by ShellBoost.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandPopulationPolicy.AlwaysFull
member.summary: The platform will assume that placeholder files and directories are always available locally.

If the file system implementation does not support the AllChildrenEnumeration capability, the synchronizer will always use a null options, or an options with the Level property set to Children. If the file system implementation supports the AllChildrenEnumeration capability, the synchronizer will always use a non-root Parent Id with a null options, or a root Parent Id with an options with Level property set to AllChildren.
member.returns: A list of child entries.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandLocalFileSystemOptions.SynchronizationStateEndPointSynchronizerIdentifiers
member.summary: Gets a list of endpoint synchronizers that give synchronization state for files and folders. Endpoint synchronizers listed here will be asked to determine if a file or folder is considered synchronized or not. You can add the "*" special identifier to indicate all endpoint synchronizers will be asked for that information. If this list is empty, a file or folder present on the local disk will always be considered synchronized.
member.value: A list of endpoint synchronizer identifiers.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Synchronization.OnDemandLocalFileSystemRegistration.EnableFolderIndexing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to explicitly enable the root folder for indexing. Indexing is required for progress reporting to the Windows Shell. If the root folder is not under a directory that's already enabled and report progress to Windows Shell is desired, this property must be set to true. Only a Fixed drive can enabled for indexing. If this value was set to true and indexing is not possible, the value will be set back to false after registration code has ran.
member.value: true if explicitly enable the root folder for indexing, false.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES
member.summary: Specifies various capabilities when initializing COM security.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_NONE
member.summary: Indicates that no capability flags are set.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_MUTUAL_AUTH
member.summary: If this flag is specified, it will be ignored. Support for mutual authentication is automatically provided by some authentication services.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_STATIC_CLOAKING
member.summary: Sets static cloaking. When this flag is set, DCOM uses the thread token (if present) when determining the client's identity.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_DYNAMIC_CLOAKING
member.summary: Sets dynamic cloaking. When this flag is set, DCOM uses the thread token (if present) when determining the client's identity.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_ANY_AUTHORITY
member.summary: This flag is obsolete.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_MAKE_FULLSIC
member.summary: Causes DCOM to send Schannel server principal names in fullsic format to clients as part of the default security negotiation. The name is extracted from the server certificate.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_DEFAULT
member.summary: Tells DCOM to use the valid capabilities from the call to CoInitializeSecurity. If CoInitializeSecurity was not called, EOAC_NONE will be used for the capabilities flag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_SECURE_REFS
member.summary: Authenticates distributed reference count calls to prevent malicious users from releasing objects that are still being used. If this flag is set, which can be done only in a call to CoInitializeSecurity by the client, the authentication level (in dwAuthnLevel) cannot be set to none.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_ACCESS_CONTROL
member.summary: Indicates that the pSecDesc parameter to CoInitializeSecurity is a pointer to an IAccessControl interface on an access control object. When DCOM makes security checks, it calls IAccessControl::IsAccessAllowed. This flag is set only by the server.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_APPID
member.summary: Indicates that the pSecDesc parameter to CoInitializeSecurity is a pointer to a GUID that is an AppID. The CoInitializeSecurity function looks up the AppID in the registry and reads the security settings from there. If this flag is set, all other parameters to CoInitializeSecurity are ignored and must be zero. Only the server can set this flag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_DYNAMIC
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_REQUIRE_FULLSIC
member.summary: Causes DCOM to fail CoSetProxyBlanket calls where an Schannel principal name is specified in any format other than fullsic. This flag is currently for clients only.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_AUTO_IMPERSONATE
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_DISABLE_AAA
member.summary: Causes any activation where a server process would be launched under the caller's identity (activate-as-activator) to fail with E_ACCESSDENIED. This value, which can be specified only in a call to CoInitializeSecurity by the client, allows an application that runs under a privileged account (such as LocalSystem) to help prevent its identity from being used to launch untrusted components.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_NO_CUSTOM_MARSHAL
member.summary: Specifying this flag helps protect server security when using DCOM or COM+. It reduces the chances of executing arbitrary DLLs because it allows the marshaling of only CLSIDs that are implemented in Ole32.dll, ComAdmin.dll, ComSvcs.dll, or Es.dll, or that implement the CATID_MARSHALER category ID. Any service that is critical to system operation should set this flag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.EOLE_AUTHENTICATION_CAPABILITIES.EOAC_RESERVED1
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.REGCLS

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.REGCLS.REGCLS_SINGLEUSE
member.summary: After an application is connected to a class object with CoGetClassObject, the class object is removed from public view so that no other applications can connect to it.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.REGCLS.REGCLS_MULTIPLEUSE
member.summary: Multiple applications can connect to the class object through calls to CoGetClassObject.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.REGCLS.REGCLS_MULTI_SEPARATE
member.summary: Useful for registering separate CLSCTX_LOCAL_SERVER and CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER class factories through calls to CoGetClassObject.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.REGCLS.REGCLS_SUSPENDED
member.summary: Suspends registration and activation requests for the specified CLSID until there is a call to CoResumeClassObjects.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.REGCLS.REGCLS_SURROGATE
member.summary: The class object is a surrogate process used to run DLL servers.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.REGCLS.REGCLS_AGILE
member.summary: The class object aggregates the free-threaded marshaler and will be made visible to all inproc apartments.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL
member.summary: Specifies an authentication level, which indicates the amount of authentication provided to help protect the integrity of the data. Each level includes the protection provided by the previous levels.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL_DEFAULT
member.summary: Tells DCOM to choose the authentication level using its normal security blanket negotiation algorithm.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL_NONE
member.summary: Performs no authentication.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL_CONNECT
member.summary: Authenticates the credentials of the client only when the client establishes a relationship with the server.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL_CALL
member.summary: Authenticates only at the beginning of each remote procedure call when the server receives the request.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL_PKT
member.summary: Authenticates that all data received is from the expected client.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL_PKT_INTEGRITY
member.summary: Authenticates and verifies that none of the data transferred between client and server has been modified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL.RPC_C_AUTHN_LEVEL_PKT_PRIVACY
member.summary: Authenticates all previous levels and encrypts the argument value of each remote procedure call.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL
member.summary: Specifies an impersonation level, which indicates the amount of authority given to the server when it is impersonating the client.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL_DEFAULT
member.summary: DCOM can choose the impersonation level using its normal security blanket negotiation algorithm.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL_ANONYMOUS
member.summary: The client is anonymous to the server. The server process can impersonate the client, but the impersonation token will not contain any information and cannot be used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL_IDENTIFY
member.summary: The server can obtain the client's identity. The server can impersonate the client for ACL checking, but it cannot access system objects as the client.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL_IMPERSONATE
member.summary: The server process can impersonate the client's security context while acting on behalf of the client. This level of impersonation can be used to access local resources such as files. When impersonating at this level, the impersonation token can only be passed across one machine boundary. The Schannel authentication service only supports this level of impersonation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL.RPC_C_IMP_LEVEL_DELEGATE
member.summary: The server process can impersonate the client's security context while acting on behalf of the client. The server process can also make outgoing calls to other servers while acting on behalf of the client, using cloaking. The server may use the client's security context on other machines to access local and remote resources as the client. When impersonating at this level, the impersonation token can be passed across any number of computer boundaries.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.STGC
member.summary: Specify the conditions for performing the commit operation in the IStorage::Commit and IStream::Commit methods.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.STGC.STGC_DEFAULT
member.summary: You can specify this condition with STGC_CONSOLIDATE, or some combination of the other three flags in this list of elements. Use this value to increase the readability of code.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.STGC.STGC_OVERWRITE
member.summary: The commit operation can overwrite existing data to reduce overall space requirements. This value is not recommended for typical usage because it is not as robust as the default value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.STGC.STGC_ONLYIFCURRENT
member.summary: Prevents multiple users of a storage object from overwriting each other's changes. The commit operation occurs only if there have been no changes to the saved storage object because the user most recently opened it.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.STGC.STGC_DANGEROUSLYCOMMITMERELYTODISKCACHE
member.summary: Commits the changes to a write-behind disk cache, but does not save the cache to the disk. In a write-behind disk cache, the operation that writes to disk actually writes to a disk cache, thus increasing performance.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.STGC.STGC_CONSOLIDATE
member.summary: Indicates that a storage should be consolidated after it is committed, resulting in a smaller file on disk.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.StreamOnIStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WDA.WDA_MONITOR
member.summary: Display the content only on a monitor.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WDA.WDA_EXCLUDEFROMCAPTURE
member.summary: Display the content only on a monitor and excluded everywhere else. Introduced in Windows 10 Version 2004.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.CWP
member.summary: Defines options to skip child windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.CWP.CWP_ALL
member.summary: Does not skip any child windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.CWP.CWP_SKIPINVISIBLE
member.summary: Skips invisible child windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.CWP.CWP_SKIPDISABLED
member.summary: Skips disabled child windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.CWP.CWP_SKIPTRANSPARENT
member.summary: Skips transparent child windows.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW
member.summary: Defines options that can be used to invalidate or validate a window, control repainting, and control which windows are affected by RedrawWindow.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_NONE
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_INVALIDATE
member.summary: Invalidates lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate (only one may be non-NULL). If both are NULL, the entire window is invalidated.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_INTERNALPAINT
member.summary: Causes a WM_PAINT message to be posted to the window regardless of whether any portion of the window is invalid.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_ERASE
member.summary: Causes the window to receive a WM_ERASEBKGND message when the window is repainted. The RDW_INVALIDATE flag must also be specified; otherwise, RDW_ERASE has no effect.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_VALIDATE
member.summary: Validates lprcUpdate or hrgnUpdate (only one may be non-NULL). If both are NULL, the entire window is validated. This flag does not affect internal WM_PAINT messages.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_NOINTERNALPAINT
member.summary: Suppresses any pending internal WM_PAINT messages. This flag does not affect WM_PAINT messages resulting from a non-NULL update area.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_NOERASE
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_ERASEBKGND messages.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_NOCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes child windows, if any, from the repainting operation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_ALLCHILDREN
member.summary: Includes child windows, if any, in the repainting operation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_UPDATENOW
member.summary: Causes the affected windows (as specified by the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN flags) to receive WM_NCPAINT, WM_ERASEBKGND, and WM_PAINT messages, if necessary, before the function returns.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_ERASENOW
member.summary: Causes the affected windows (as specified by the RDW_ALLCHILDREN and RDW_NOCHILDREN flags) to receive WM_NCPAINT and WM_ERASEBKGND messages, if necessary, before the function returns. WM_PAINT messages are received at the ordinary time.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_FRAME
member.summary: Causes any part of the nonclient area of the window that intersects the update region to receive a WM_NCPAINT message. The RDW_INVALIDATE flag must also be specified; otherwise, RDW_FRAME has no effect. The WM_NCPAINT message is typically not sent during the execution of RedrawWindow unless either RDW_UPDATENOW or RDW_ERASENOW is specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW.RDW_NOFRAME
member.summary: Suppresses any pending WM_NCPAINT messages. This flag must be used with RDW_VALIDATE and is typically used with RDW_NOCHILDREN. RDW_NOFRAME should be used with care, as it could cause parts of a window to be painted improperly.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings
member.summary: Represents a Shell Folder custom settings (desktop.ini).

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings.Remove(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes custom Shell Folder settings. This function deletes the Desktop.ini.
member.param: if set to true errors may be throw in case of Windows Shell errors.
member.returns: An error number or 0.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings.Get(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves a custom Shell Folder settings. This function reads from the Desktop.ini.
member.param: if set to true errors may be throw in case of Windows Shell errors.
member.returns: An error number or 0.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings.InfoTip
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the folder's infotip.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings.Clsid
member.summary: Gets or sets the CLSID used to identify the Shell Folder in the Windows registry.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings.IconFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the path to file containing the folder's icon.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings.IconIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the icon within the file named in IconFile.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings.Logo
member.summary: Gets or sets a string containing the path to the file containing the folder's logo image. This is the image used in thumbnail views.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellFolderCustomSettings.Set(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a custom Shell Folder settings. This function writes to Desktop.ini.
member.param: if set to true the custom folder's settings will be set regardless of whether the values are already present.
if set to true errors may be throw in case of Windows Shell errors.
member.returns: An error number or 0.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP
member.summary: Defines a window sizing and positioning options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NONE
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NOSIZE
member.summary: Retains the current size (ignores the cx and cy parameters).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NOMOVE
member.summary: Retains the current position (ignores X and Y parameters).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NOZORDER
member.summary: Retains the current Z order (ignores the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NOREDRAW
member.summary: Does not redraw changes. If this flag is set, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of the window being moved. When this flag is set, the application must explicitly invalidate or redraw any parts of the window and parent window that need redrawing.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: Does not activate the window. If this flag is not set, the window is activated and moved to the top of either the topmost or non-topmost group (depending on the setting of the hWndInsertAfter parameter).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_DRAWFRAME
member.summary: Draws a frame (defined in the window's class description) around the window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_FRAMECHANGED
member.summary: Applies new frame styles set using the SetWindowLong function. Sends a WM_NCCALCSIZE message to the window, even if the window's size is not being changed. If this flag is not specified, WM_NCCALCSIZE is sent only when the window's size is being changed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_SHOWWINDOW
member.summary: Displays the window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_HIDEWINDOW
member.summary: Hides the window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NOCOPYBITS
member.summary: Discards the entire contents of the client area. If this flag is not specified, the valid contents of the client area are saved and copied back into the client area after the window is sized or repositioned.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NOREPOSITION
member.summary: Same as the SWP_NOOWNERZORDER flag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NOOWNERZORDER
member.summary: Does not change the owner window's position in the Z order.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_NOSENDCHANGING
member.summary: Prevents the window from receiving the WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING message.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_DEFERERASE
member.summary: Prevents generation of the WM_SYNCPAINT message.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP.SWP_ASYNCWINDOWPOS
member.summary: If the calling thread and the thread that owns the window are attached to different input queues, the system posts the request to the thread that owns the window. This prevents the calling thread from blocking its execution while other threads process the request.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowProperty
member.summary: Defines a Window property.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowProperty.#ctor(System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowProperty.Name
member.summary: Gets the property name.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowProperty.Handle
member.summary: Gets the property data handle.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowProperty.ToString
member.summary: Converts to string.
member.returns: A that represents this instance.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS
member.summary: Defines a window styles.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_NONE
member.summary: No style.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_BORDER
member.summary: The window has a thin-line border.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_CAPTION
member.summary: The window has a title bar (includes the WS_BORDER style).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_CHILD
member.summary: The window is a child window. A window with this style cannot have a menu bar. This style cannot be used with the WS_POPUP style.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_CLIPCHILDREN
member.summary: Excludes the area occupied by child windows when drawing occurs within the parent window. This style is used when creating the parent window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_CLIPSIBLINGS
member.summary: Clips child windows relative to each other; that is, when a particular child window receives a WM_PAINT message, the WS_CLIPSIBLINGS style clips all other overlapping child windows out of the region of the child window to be updated. If WS_CLIPSIBLINGS is not specified and child windows overlap, it is possible, when drawing within the client area of a child window, to draw within the client area of a neighboring child window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_DISABLED
member.summary: The window is initially disabled. A disabled window cannot receive input from the user. To change this after a window has been created, use the EnableWindow function.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_DLGFRAME
member.summary: The window has a border of a style typically used with dialog boxes. A window with this style cannot have a title bar.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_GROUP
member.summary: The window is the first control of a group of controls. The group consists of this first control and all controls defined after it, up to the next control with the WS_GROUP style. The first control in each group usually has the WS_TABSTOP style so that the user can move from group to group

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_HSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a horizontal scroll bar.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_MAXIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially maximized.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_MAXIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a maximize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_MINIMIZE
member.summary: The window is initially minimized.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_MINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: The window has a minimize button. Cannot be combined with the WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP style. The WS_SYSMENU style must also be specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_OVERLAPPED
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window. An overlapped window has a title bar and a border.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_POPUP
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. This style cannot be used with the WS_CHILD style.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_POPUPWINDOW
member.summary: The window is a pop-up window. The WS_CAPTION and WS_POPUPWINDOW styles must be combined to make the window menu visible.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_SYSMENU
member.summary: The window has a window menu on its title bar. The WS_CAPTION style must also be specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_TABSTOP
member.summary: The window is a control that can receive the keyboard focus when the user presses the TAB key. Pressing the TAB key changes the keyboard focus to the next control with the WS_TABSTOP style.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_THICKFRAME
member.summary: The window has a sizing border.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_VISIBLE
member.summary: The window is initially visible. This style can be turned on and off by using the ShowWindow or SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS.WS_VSCROLL
member.summary: The window has a vertical scroll bar.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX
member.summary: Defines a window extended styles.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_DLGMODALFRAME
member.summary: The window has a double border; the window can, optionally, be created with a title bar by specifying the WS_CAPTION style in the dwStyle parameter.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_NOPARENTNOTIFY
member.summary: The child window created with this style does not send the WM_PARENTNOTIFY message to its parent window when it is created or destroyed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_TOPMOST
member.summary: The window should be placed above all non-topmost windows and should stay above them, even when the window is deactivated. To add or remove this style, use the SetWindowPos function.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_ACCEPTFILES
member.summary: The window accepts drag-drop files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: The window should not be painted until siblings beneath the window (that were created by the same thread) have been painted. The window appears transparent because the bits of underlying sibling windows have already been painted.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_MDICHILD
member.summary: The window is a MDI child window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_TOOLWINDOW
member.summary: The window is intended to be used as a floating toolbar. A tool window has a title bar that is shorter than a normal title bar, and the window title is drawn using a smaller font. A tool window does not appear in the taskbar or in the dialog that appears when the user presses ALT+TAB. If a tool window has a system menu, its icon is not displayed on the title bar. However, you can display the system menu by right-clicking or by typing ALT+SPACE.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_WINDOWEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a raised edge.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_CLIENTEDGE
member.summary: The window has a border with a sunken edge.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
member.summary: The title bar of the window includes a question mark. When the user clicks the question mark, the cursor changes to a question mark with a pointer. If the user then clicks a child window, the child receives a WM_HELP message.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_RIGHT
member.summary: The window has generic "right-aligned" properties. This depends on the window class. This style has an effect only if the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment; otherwise, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_LEFT
member.summary: The window has generic left-aligned properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_RTLREADING
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading-order alignment, the window text is displayed using right-to-left reading-order properties. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_LTRREADING
member.summary: The window text is displayed using left-to-right reading-order properties. This is the default.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_LEFTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the left of the client area. For other languages, the style is ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_RIGHTSCROLLBAR
member.summary: The vertical scroll bar (if present) is to the right of the client area. This is the default.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_CONTROLPARENT
member.summary: The window itself contains child windows that should take part in dialog box navigation. If this style is specified, the dialog manager recurses into children of this window when performing navigation operations such as handling the TAB key, an arrow key, or a keyboard mnemonic.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_STATICEDGE
member.summary: The window has a three-dimensional border style intended to be used for items that do not accept user input.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_APPWINDOW
member.summary: Forces a top-level window onto the taskbar when the window is visible.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_OVERLAPPEDWINDOW
member.summary: The window is an overlapped window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_PALETTEWINDOW
member.summary: The window is palette window, which is a modeless dialog box that presents an array of commands.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_LAYERED
member.summary: The window is a layered window. This style cannot be used if the window has a class style of either CS_OWNDC or CS_CLASSDC. Windows 8: The WS_EX_LAYERED style is supported for top-level windows and child windows. Previous Windows versions support WS_EX_LAYERED only for top-level windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_NOINHERITLAYOUT
member.summary: The window does not pass its window layout to its child windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_NOREDIRECTIONBITMAP
member.summary: The window does not render to a redirection surface. This is for windows that do not have visible content or that use mechanisms other than surfaces to provide their visual.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: If the shell language is Hebrew, Arabic, or another language that supports reading order alignment, the horizontal origin of the window is on the right edge. Increasing horizontal values advance to the left.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_COMPOSITED
member.summary: Paints all descendants of a window in bottom-to-top painting order using double-buffering. Bottom-to-top painting order allows a descendent window to have translucency (alpha) and transparency (color-key) effects, but only if the descendent window also has the WS_EX_TRANSPARENT bit set. Double-buffering allows the window and its descendents to be painted without flicker.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WS_EX.WS_EX_NOACTIVATE
member.summary: A top-level window created with this style does not become the foreground window when the user clicks it. The system does not bring this window to the foreground when the user minimizes or closes the foreground window. The window should not be activated through programmatic access or via keyboard navigation by accessible technology, such as Narrator.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.DynamicComObject
member.summary: Defines a dynamic wrapper class over a COM object. Only useful for supporting .NET Core code.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.DynamicComObject.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.DynamicComObject.NativeObject
member.summary: Gets the underlying native COM object.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.DynamicComObject.Create(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a COM object from a progID.
member.param: true to throw any exception that occurs.-or- false to ignore any exception that occurs.
member.returns: An instance of a COM object or null.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.DynamicComObject.Create(System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a COM object from a CLSID.
member.param: true to throw any exception that occurs.-or- false to ignore any exception that occurs.
member.returns: An instance of a COM object or null.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.DynamicComObject.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as getting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to .
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.DynamicComObject.TryGetIndex(System.Dynamic.GetIndexBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get a value by index. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for indexing operations.
member.param: The indexes that are used in the operation.
The result of the index operation.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.DynamicComObject.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, the is "Test".
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.DynamicComObject.TryInvokeMember(System.Dynamic.InvokeMemberBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that invoke a member. Classes derived from the class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as calling a method.
member.param: Provides information about the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleMethod(100), where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the class, binder.Name returns "SampleMethod". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The arguments that are passed to the object member during the invoke operation.
The result of the member invocation.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat
member.summary: Specifies a format for a directory service object name.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.FullyQualifiedDN
member.summary: The fully qualified distinguished name (for example, CN=Jeff Smith,OU=Users,DC=Engineering,DC=Microsoft,DC=Com).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.SamCompatible
member.summary: A legacy account name (for example, Engineering\JSmith). The domain-only version includes trailing backslashes (\).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.Display
member.summary: A "friendly" display name (for example, Jeff Smith). The display name is not necessarily the defining relative distinguished name (RDN).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.UniqueId
member.summary: A GUID string that the IIDFromString function returns (for example, {4fa050f0-f561-11cf-bdd9-00aa003a77b6}).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.Canonical
member.summary: The complete canonical name (for example, engineering.microsoft.com/software/someone). The domain-only version includes a trailing forward slash (/).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.UserPrincipal
member.summary: The user principal name (for example, someone@example.com).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.CanonicalEx
member.summary: The same as NameCanonical except that the rightmost forward slash (/) is replaced with a new line character (\n), even in a domain-only case (for example, engineering.microsoft.com/software\nJSmith).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.ServicePrincipal
member.summary: The generalized service principal name (for example, www/www.microsoft.com@microsoft.com).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.DnsDomain
member.summary: The DNS domain name followed by a backward-slash and the SAM user name.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.GivenName
member.summary: The given name.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat.Surname
member.summary: The surname.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChangeNotifier
member.summary: Listens to Windows Shell change notifications and raises events when a notification is received. Note events can arrive from any thread.

member.summary: Occurs when a Windows Shell change notifications is received. Note events can arrive from any thread.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The PIDL for which to receive notifications. Pass null to monitor all children.
Indicates whether to post notifications for children of this PIDL. For example, if the PIDL points to a folder, then file notifications would come from the folder's children if this flag was true.
A combination of values that indicate the type of events for which to receive notifications.
The timeout in milliseconds to wait for an error.
Flags that indicate the type of events for which to receive notifications. Note SHCNRF_NewDelivery is always set implicitly.

member.summary: Gets the monitored PIDL. May be null.

member.summary: Gets or sets the register flags.

member.summary: Called when a Windows Shell change notifications is received.
member.param: The instance containing the event data.

member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChunkedMemoryStream.Flush
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device. This implementation does nothing.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChunkedMemoryStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChunkedMemoryStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChunkedMemoryStream.ToArray
member.summary: Converts the current stream to a byte array.
member.returns: An array of bytes

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChunkedMemoryStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ChunkedMemoryStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.
member.param: The byte to write to the stream.

member.summary: Writes to the specified stream.
