member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags
member.summary: A combination of flags associated with the specified file system.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_CASE_SENSITIVE_SEARCH
member.summary: The specified volume supports case-sensitive file names.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_CASE_PRESERVED_NAMES
member.summary: The specified volume supports preserved case of file names when it places a name on disk.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_UNICODE_ON_DISK
member.summary: The specified volume supports Unicode in file names as they appear on disk.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_PERSISTENT_ACLS
member.summary: The specified volume preserves and enforces access control lists (ACL). For example, the NTFS file system preserves and enforces ACLs, and the FAT file system does not.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_FILE_COMPRESSION
member.summary: The specified volume supports file-based compression.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_VOLUME_QUOTAS
member.summary: The specified volume supports disk quotas.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_SPARSE_FILES
member.summary: The specified volume supports sparse files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_REPARSE_POINTS
member.summary: The specified volume supports reparse points.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_REMOTE_STORAGE
member.summary: The file system supports remote storage.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_RETURNS_CLEANUP_RESULT_INFO
member.summary: On a successful cleanup operation, the file system returns information that describes additional actions taken during cleanup, such as deleting the file. File system filters can examine this information in their post-cleanup callback.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_POSIX_UNLINK_RENAME
member.summary: The file system supports POSIX-style delete and rename operations.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_VOLUME_IS_COMPRESSED
member.summary: The specified volume is a compressed volume, for example, a DoubleSpace volume.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_OBJECT_IDS
member.summary: The specified volume supports object identifiers.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_ENCRYPTION
member.summary: The specified volume supports the Encrypted File System (EFS).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_NAMED_STREAMS
member.summary: The specified volume supports named streams.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_READ_ONLY_VOLUME
member.summary: The specified volume is read-only.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SEQUENTIAL_WRITE_ONCE
member.summary: The specified volume supports a single sequential write.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_TRANSACTIONS
member.summary: The specified volume supports transactions.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_HARD_LINKS
member.summary: The specified volume supports hard links.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_EXTENDED_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: The specified volume supports extended attributes. An extended attribute is a piece of application-specific metadata that an application can associate with a file and is not part of the file's data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_OPEN_BY_FILE_ID
member.summary: The file system supports OpenByFileID.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_USN_JOURNAL
member.summary: The specified volume supports update sequence number (USN) journals.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_INTEGRITY_STREAMS
member.summary: The file system supports integrity streams.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_BLOCK_REFCOUNTING
member.summary: The file system supports block cloning, that is, sharing logical clusters between files on the same volume. The file system reallocates on writes to shared clusters.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_SPARSE_VDL
member.summary: The file system tracks whether each cluster of a file contains valid data (either from explicit file writes or automatic zeros) or invalid data (has not yet been written to or zeroed).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_DAX_VOLUME
member.summary: The specified volume is a direct access (DAX) volume.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.FileSystemVolumeFlags.FILE_SUPPORTS_GHOSTING
member.summary: The file system supports ghosting.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.ShellUtilities.ExtractMenu(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Extracts all menu items from a shell item's context menu.
member.remarks: This method behavior depends on many contextual parameters such as the process bitness (32 or 64 bit), the type of process (Console vs Windows), or the the current thread's COM apartment state (STA vs MTA, etc.). It also depends on how dynamic context menu handlers choose to add or not menu items.
member.param: true to throw error; otherwise false.
member.returns: A list of ShellMenuItem instances.

member.summary: Runs an action on all menu items from a shell item's context menu.
member.param: The action to run. First parameter is the current item's parent (which can be null for top level items), second parameter is the current item.
true to throw error; otherwise false.
member.returns: 0 or an error code.
member.remarks: This method behavior depends on many contextual parameters such as the process bitness (32 or 64 bit), the type of process (Console vs Windows), or the the current thread's COM apartment state (STA vs MTA, etc.). It also depends on how dynamic context menu handlers choose to add or not menu items.

member.summary: Occurs when a task is being executed.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An optional function to configure the thread before it's started. If the function returns false, the thread is not automatically started.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.LastDequeue
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the last dequeue time.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.DequeueOnDispose
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to dequeue the remaining tasks when this instance is disposed. Dequeuing will happen on the thread callind Dispose(), not on the scheduler's thread.
member.value: A value indicating whether to dequeue the remaining tasks when this instance is disposed.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.DisposeThreadJoinTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the maximum time to wait for the thread to finish when this instance is disposed.
member.value: A value that defines the maximum time to wait for the thread to finish when this instance is disposed.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.WaitTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the maximum time to periodically wait for stop and dequeue events to happen.
member.value: A value that defines the maximum time to periodically wait for stop and dequeue events to happen.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.DequeueTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that defines the time to wait between dequeues.
member.value: A value that defines the time to wait between dequeues.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.QueueCount
member.summary: Gets the number of currently queued tasks.
member.value: The number of currently queued tasks.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.ClearQueue
member.summary: Remove all tasks from the queue. Dequeuing will happen on the current thread, not on the scheduler's thread.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.TriggerDequeue
member.summary: Executes any tasks in queue, sending a dequeue event to the thread.
member.returns: true if the dequeue event

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by this instance.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.QueueTask(System.Threading.Tasks.Task)
member.summary: Queues a task to the scheduler.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.GetScheduledTasks
member.summary: Gets the list of tasks in the queue.
member.returns: A list of tasks in the queue.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SingleThreadTaskScheduler.TryExecuteTaskInline(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether the provided task can be executed synchronously in this call, and if it can, executes it. This implementation always retuns false.
member.param: A Boolean denoting whether or not task has previously been queued.
member.returns: This implementation always retuns false.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.IsHungApp
member.summary: Determines whether the system considers that a specified application is not responding. An application is considered to be not responding if it is not waiting for input, is not in startup processing, and has not called PeekMessage within the internal timeout period of 5 seconds. This function is not intended for general use. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions of Windows.
member.value: true if this window stops responding; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.LastActivePopup
member.summary: Determines which pop-up window owned by this window was most recently active. The return value is the same as the handle parameter, if any of the following conditions are met: 1) The window identified by hWnd was most recently active. 2) The window identified by hWnd does not own any pop-up windows. 3) The window identifies by hWnd is not a top-level window, or it is owned by another window.
member.value: A handle to the last active popup window.

member.name: P:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.ClientRect
member.summary: Gets the coordinates of a window's client area. The client coordinates specify the upper-left and lower-right corners of the client area. Because client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of a window's client area, the coordinates of the upper-left corner are (0,0).
member.value: A RECT structure receives the client coordinates. The left and top members are zero. The right and bottom members contain the width and height of the window.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.SetProperty(System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Adds a new entry or changes an existing entry in the property list of the specified window. The function adds a new entry to the list if the specified character string does not exist already in the list. The new entry contains the string and the handle. Otherwise, the function replaces the string's current handle with the specified handle.
member.param: A handle to the data to be copied to the property list. The data handle can identify any value useful to the application.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.BringToTop
member.summary: Brings this window to the top of the Z order. If the window is a top-level window, it is activated. If the window is a child window, the top-level parent window associated with the child window is activated.
member.returns: true if call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.GetChildWindowFromPoint(ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.POINT,ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.CWP)
member.summary: Determines which, if any, of the child windows belonging to this parent window contains the specified point. The function can ignore invisible, disabled, and transparent child windows. The search is restricted to immediate child windows. Grandchildren and deeper descendants are not searched.
member.param: defines the client coordinates (relative to hwndParent) of the point to be checked.
member.returns: A handle to the first child window that contains the point and meets the criteria specified by flags.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.Move(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the position and dimensions of this window. For a top-level window, the position and dimensions are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. For a child window, they are relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area.
member.param: The new position of the left side of the window.
The new position of the top of the window.
The new width of the window.
The new height of the window.

Indicates whether the window is to be repainted. If this parameter is true, the window receives a message. If the parameter is false, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of moving a child window.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.MapPoints(System.IntPtr,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.POINT})
member.summary: Converts (maps) a set of points from a coordinate space relative to this window to a coordinate space relative to another window.
member.param: A handle to the window to which points are converted. If this parameter is Zero or HWND_DESKTOP, the points are converted to screen coordinates.
A list of POINTs that contain the set of points to be converted. The points are in device units.
member.returns: A list of converted POINTs. If the function failed, the list is empty.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.Move(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the position of this window. For a top-level window, the position is relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. For a child window, it's relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area.
member.param: The new position of the left side of the window.
The new position of the top of the window.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.Update
member.summary: updates the client area of this window by sending a WM_PAINT message to the window if the window's update region is not empty. The function sends a WM_PAINT message directly to the window procedure of this window, bypassing the application queue. If the update region is empty, no message is sent.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.Resize(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the dimensions of this window. For a top-level window, the dimensions are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. For a child window, they are relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area.
member.param: The new width of the window.
The new height of the window.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.summary: Converts the screen coordinates of a specified point on the screen to client-area coordinates.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.ClientToScreen(ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.POINT)
member.summary: converts the client-area coordinates of a specified point to screen coordinates.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.SetWindowPos(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP)
member.summary: Changes the size, position, and Z order of this window. These windows are ordered according to their appearance on the screen, the topmost window receives the highest rank and is the first window in the Z order.
member.param: A handle to the window to precede the positioned window in the Z order. This parameter must be a window handle or one of the following values: HWND_BOTTOM, HWND_NOTOPMOST, HWND_TOP, HWND_TOPMOST.
The new position of the left side of the window, in client coordinates.
The new position of the top of the window, in client coordinates.
The new width of the window, in pixels.
The new height of the window, in pixels.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.SetForeground
member.summary: Brings the thread that created this window into the foreground and activates this window. Keyboard input is directed to the window, and various visual cues are changed for the user. The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that created the foreground window than it does to other threads.
member.returns: true if the window was brought to the foreground, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.ReleaseDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Releases a device context (DC), freeing it for use by other applications. The effect of the ReleaseDC function depends on the type of DC. It frees only common and window DCs. It has no effect on class or private DCs.

member.returns: If the DC was released, the return value is true, otherwise it's false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.InvalidateRect(ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.RECT,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a rectangle to this window's update region. The update region represents the portion of the window's client area that must be redrawn.
member.param: The client coordinates of the rectangle to be added to the update region.

Specifies whether the background within the update region is to be erased when the update region is processed. If this parameter is true, the background is erased when the BeginPaint function is called. If this parameter is false, the background remains unchanged.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.InvalidateRgn(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Invalidates the client area within the specified region by adding it to the current update region of a window. The invalidated region, along with all other areas in the update region, is marked for painting when the next WM_PAINT message occurs.
member.param: A handle to the region to be added to the update region. The region is assumed to have client coordinates. If this parameter is Zero, the entire client area is added to the update region.

Specifies whether the background within the update region should be erased when the update region is processed. If this parameter is true, the background is erased when the BeginPaint function is called. If the parameter is false, the background remains unchanged.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.Win32Window.Invalidate(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Invalidates this window's client area.
member.param: Specifies whether the background within the update region is to be erased when the update region is processed. If this parameter is true, the background is erased when the BeginPaint function is called. If this parameter is false, the background remains unchanged.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.SetProp(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Adds a new entry or changes an existing entry in the property list of the specified window. The function adds a new entry to the list if the specified character string does not exist already in the list. The new entry contains the string and the handle. Otherwise, the function replaces the string's current handle with the specified handle.
member.param: A handle to the window whose property list receives the new entry.
A handle to the data to be copied to the property list. The data handle can identify any value useful to the application.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetProp(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves a data handle from the property list of the specified window. The character string identifies the handle to be retrieved. The string and handle must have been added to the property list by a previous call to the SetProp function.
member.param: A handle to the window whose property list is to be searched.
member.returns: The associated data handle or IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.RemoveProp(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Removes an entry from the property list of the specified window. The specified character string identifies the entry to be removed.
member.param: A handle to the window whose property list is to be changed.
member.returns: The associated data handle or IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetWindowDC(System.IntPtr)

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.RedrawWindow(System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW)
member.summary: Updates the entire client area of window.
member.param: A handle to the window to be redrawn. If this parameter is Zero, the desktop window is updated.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.RedrawWindow(System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.RECT,ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW)
member.summary: Updates the specified rectangle in a window's client area.
member.param: A handle to the window to be redrawn. If this parameter is Zero, the desktop window is updated.
The coordinates, in device units, of the update rectangle.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.RedrawWindow(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.RDW)
member.summary: Updates the region in a window's client area.
member.param: A handle to the window to be redrawn. If this parameter is Zero, the desktop window is updated.
A handle to the update region.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.InvalidateRect(System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.RECT,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a rectangle to the specified window's update region. The update region represents the portion of the window's client area that must be redrawn.
member.param: A handle to the window whose update region has changed.
The client coordinates of the rectangle to be added to the update region.

Specifies whether the background within the update region is to be erased when the update region is processed. If this parameter is true, the background is erased when the BeginPaint function is called. If this parameter is false, the background remains unchanged.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.Invalidate(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Invalidates the specified window's client area.
member.param: A handle to the window whose update region has changed.

Specifies whether the background within the update region is to be erased when the update region is processed. If this parameter is true, the background is erased when the BeginPaint function is called. If this parameter is false, the background remains unchanged.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.InvalidateRgn(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Invalidates the client area within the specified region by adding it to the current update region of a window. The invalidated region, along with all other areas in the update region, is marked for painting when the next WM_PAINT message occurs.
member.param: A handle to the window with an update region that is to be modified.
A handle to the region to be added to the update region. The region is assumed to have client coordinates. If this parameter is Zero, the entire client area is added to the update region.

Specifies whether the background within the update region should be erased when the update region is processed. If this parameter is true, the background is erased when the BeginPaint function is called. If the parameter is false, the background remains unchanged.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.ReleaseDC(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Releases a device context (DC), freeing it for use by other applications. The effect of the ReleaseDC function depends on the type of DC. It frees only common and window DCs. It has no effect on class or private DCs.
member.param: A handle to the window whose DC is to be released.
A handle to the DC to be released.
member.returns: If the DC was released, the return value is 1, otherwise it's zero.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.WindowFromDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the window associated with the specified display device context (DC).

member.returns: A handle to the window associated with the specified DC or IntPtr.Zero

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.SwitchToThisWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetLastActivePopup(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determines which pop-up window owned by the specified window was most recently active. The return value is the same as the handle parameter, if any of the following conditions are met: 1) The window identified by hWnd was most recently active. 2) The window identified by hWnd does not own any pop-up windows. 3) The window identifies by hWnd is not a top-level window, or it is owned by another window.
member.returns: A handle to the last active popup window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.ApplicationIcon

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetShellWindow
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the Shell's desktop window.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetForegroundWindow
member.summary: Retrieves a handle to the foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working). The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that creates the foreground window than it does to other threads.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetActiveWindow
member.summary: Gets the window handle to the active window attached to the calling thread's message queue.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.SetForegroundWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Brings the thread that created the specified window into the foreground and activates the window. Keyboard input is directed to the window, and various visual cues are changed for the user. The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that created the foreground window than it does to other threads.
member.returns: true if the window was brought to the foreground, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.UpdateWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: updates the client area of the specified window by sending a WM_PAINT message to the window if the window's update region is not empty. The function sends a WM_PAINT message directly to the window procedure of the specified window, bypassing the application queue. If the update region is empty, no message is sent.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.ChildWindowFromPoint(System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.POINT,ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.CWP)
member.summary: Determines which, if any, of the child windows belonging to the specified parent window contains the specified point. The function can ignore invisible, disabled, and transparent child windows. The search is restricted to immediate child windows. Grandchildren and deeper descendants are not searched.
member.param: A handle to the parent window.
defines the client coordinates (relative to hwndParent) of the point to be checked.
member.returns: A handle to the first child window that contains the point and meets the criteria specified by flags.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.BringWindowToTop(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Brings the specified window to the top of the Z order. If the window is a top-level window, it is activated. If the window is a child window, the top-level parent window associated with the child window is activated.

member.summary: Retrieves the window handle used by the console associated with the calling process.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified window is a native Unicode window.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.IsHungAppWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determines whether the system considers that a specified application is not responding. An application is considered to be not responding if it is not waiting for input, is not in startup processing, and has not called PeekMessage within the internal timeout period of 5 seconds. This function is not intended for general use. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions of Windows.
member.returns: true if the specified window stops responding; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.SetActiveWindow(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Activates a window. The window must be attached to the calling thread's message queue.
member.param: A handle to the top-level window to be activated.
member.returns: The handle to the window that was previously active or IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.IsWindowEnabled(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified window is enabled for mouse and keyboard input.
member.param: A handle to the window to be tested.
member.returns: true if the window is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.EnableWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables mouse and keyboard input to the specified window or control. When input is disabled, the window does not receive input such as mouse clicks and key presses. When input is enabled, the window receives all input.
member.param: A handle to the window to be enabled or disabled.
if set to true enable the window; otherwise disable it.
member.returns: true if the window was previously disabled; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetWindowLong(System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WL)
member.summary: Retrieves information about the specified window. The function also retrieves the value at a specified offset into the extra window memory.
member.param: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.
The zero-based offset to the value to be retrieved.
member.returns: The requested value or IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.SetWindowLong(System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WL,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Changes an attribute of the specified window. The function also sets a value at the specified offset in the extra window memory.
member.param: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs. The SetWindowLong function fails if the process that owns the window specified by the handle parameter is at a higher process privilege in the UIPI hierarchy than the process the calling thread resides in.
The zero-based offset to the value to be set.
member.returns: The previous value or IntPtr.Zero.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.LogicalToPhysicalPoint(System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.POINT)
member.summary: Converts the logical coordinates of a point in a window to physical coordinates.
member.param: A handle to the window whose transform is used for the conversion. Top level windows are fully supported. In the case of child windows, only the area of overlap between the parent and the child window is converted.
A POINT that specifies the logical coordinates to be converted.
member.returns: A POINT if the call succeeded otherwise null.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.PhysicalToLogicalPoint(System.IntPtr,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.POINT)
member.summary: Converts the physical coordinates of a point in a window to logical coordinates.
member.param: A handle to the window whose transform is used for the conversion. Top level windows are fully supported. In the case of child windows, only the area of overlap between the parent and the child window is converted.
A POINT that specifies the physical/screen coordinates to be converted.
member.returns: A POINT if the call succeeded otherwise null.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetWindowRect(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the dimensions of the bounding rectangle of the specified window. The dimensions are given in screen coordinates that are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen.
member.returns: A RECT structure that receives the screen coordinates of the upper-left and lower-right corners of the window.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.SetWindowPos(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.SWP)
member.summary: Changes the size, position, and Z order of a child, pop-up, or top-level window. These windows are ordered according to their appearance on the screen. The topmost window receives the highest rank and is the first window in the Z order.
member.param: A handle to the window to precede the positioned window in the Z order. This parameter must be a window handle or one of the following values: HWND_BOTTOM, HWND_NOTOPMOST, HWND_TOP, HWND_TOPMOST.
The new position of the left side of the window, in client coordinates.
The new position of the top of the window, in client coordinates.
The new width of the window, in pixels.
The new height of the window, in pixels.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.MoveWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the position and dimensions of the specified window. For a top-level window, the position and dimensions are relative to the upper-left corner of the screen. For a child window, they are relative to the upper-left corner of the parent window's client area.
member.param: The new position of the left side of the window.
The new position of the top of the window.
The new width of the window.
The new height of the window.

Indicates whether the window is to be repainted. If this parameter is true, the window receives a message. If the parameter is false, no repainting of any kind occurs. This applies to the client area, the nonclient area (including the title bar and scroll bars), and any part of the parent window uncovered as a result of moving a child window.
member.returns: true if the call succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetClientRect(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Gets the coordinates of a window's client area. The client coordinates specify the upper-left and lower-right corners of the client area. Because client coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of a window's client area, the coordinates of the upper-left corner are (0,0).
member.returns: A RECT structure receives the client coordinates. The left and top members are zero. The right and bottom members contain the width and height of the window.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetUserName(ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.NameFormat,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the name of the user or other security principal associated with the calling thread. You can specify the format of the returned name. If the thread is impersonating a client, GetUserName returns the name of the client.
member.param: The format of the name. If the user account is not in a domain, only SamCompatible is supported.
true to throw error; otherwise false.
member.returns: The name in the specified format.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetProfilesDirectory(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the path to the root directory where user profiles are stored.
member.param: true to throw error; otherwise false.
member.returns: The path to the profiles directory.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.Utilities.WindowsUtilities.GetUserProfileDirectory(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)

member.returns: true if the current OS version matches, or is greater than, the Windows 8.1 version; otherwise, false.

Check this for more information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winbase/nf-winbase-verifyversioninfoa
member.returns: true if the current OS version matches, or is greater than, the Windows 10 version; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Indicates if the current OS version matches, or is greater than, the provided version information. This function is useful in confirming a version of Windows Server that doesn't share a version number with a client release. On Windows 10 this function can return false if the application has no manifest. Check this for more information: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winbase/nf-winbase-verifyversioninfoa
member.param: The major Service Pack version number.
member.returns: true if the specified version matches, or is greater than, the version of the current Windows OS; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX
member.summary: Values that are used in activation calls to indicate the execution contexts in which an object is to be run.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NONE
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER
member.summary: The code that creates and manages objects of this class is a DLL that runs in the same process as the caller of the function specifying the class context.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_HANDLER
member.summary: The code that manages objects of this class is an in-process handler. This is a DLL that runs in the client process and implements client-side structures of this class when instances of the class are accessed remotely.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_LOCAL_SERVER
member.summary: The EXE code that creates and manages objects of this class runs on same machine but is loaded in a separate process space.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER16
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_REMOTE_SERVER
member.summary: A remote context. The LocalServer32 or LocalService code that creates and manages objects of this class is run on a different computer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_HANDLER16
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED1
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED2
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED3
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED4
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NO_CODE_DOWNLOAD
member.summary: Disables the downloading of code from the directory service or the Internet. This flag cannot be set at the same time as CLSCTX_ENABLE_CODE_DOWNLOAD.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED5
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NO_CUSTOM_MARSHAL
member.summary: Specify if you want the activation to fail if it uses custom marshalling.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ENABLE_CODE_DOWNLOAD
member.summary: Enables the downloading of code from the directory service or the Internet. This flag cannot be set at the same time as CLSCTX_NO_CODE_DOWNLOAD.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NO_FAILURE_LOG
member.summary: The CLSCTX_NO_FAILURE_LOG can be used to override the logging of failures in CoCreateInstanceEx.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_DISABLE_AAA
member.summary: Disables activate-as-activator (AAA) activations for this activation only.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ENABLE_AAA
member.summary: Enables activate-as-activator (AAA) activations for this activation only.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_FROM_DEFAULT_CONTEXT
member.summary: Begin this activation from the default context of the current apartment.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_X86_SERVER
member.summary: Activate or connect to a 32-bit version of the server; fail if one is not registered.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_32_BIT_SERVER
member.summary: Activate or connect to a 32-bit version of the server; fail if one is not registered.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_64_BIT_SERVER
member.summary: Activate or connect to a 64 bit version of the server; fail if one is not registered.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ENABLE_CLOAKING
member.summary: When this flag is specified, COM uses the impersonation token of the thread, if one is present, for the activation request made by the thread. When this flag is not specified or if the thread does not have an impersonation token, COM uses the process token of the thread's process for the activation request made by the thread.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_APPCONTAINER
member.summary: Indicates activation is for an app container. This flag is reserved for internal use and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_AAA_AS_IU
member.summary: Specify this flag for Interactive User activation behavior for As-Activator servers.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED6
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_ARM32_SERVER
member.summary: Activate or connect to a 64 bit ARM version of the server; fail if one is not registered.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_PS_DLL
member.summary: Used for loading Proxy/Stub DLLs. This flag is reserved for internal use and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC
member.summary: A combination of CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER and CLSCTX_INPROC_HANDLER.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ALL
member.summary: A combination of CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, CLSCTX_INPROC_HANDLER, CLSCTX_LOCAL_SERVER and CLSCTX_REMOTE_SERVER.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_SERVER
member.summary: A combination of CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER, CLSCTX_LOCAL_SERVER and CLSCTX_REMOTE_SERVER.

member.summary: Values used by the Item's FromDataObject function to specify options concerning the processing of the source object.

member.summary: No special options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DATAOBJ_GET_ITEM_FLAGS.DOGIF_TRAVERSE_LINK
member.summary: If the source object is a link, base the IShellItem on the link's target rather than the link file itself.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DATAOBJ_GET_ITEM_FLAGS.DOGIF_NO_HDROP
member.summary: If the source data object does not contain data in the CFSTR_SHELLIDLIST format, which identifies the object through an IDList, do not revert to the CF_HDROP format, which uses a file path, as an alternative in the transfer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DATAOBJ_GET_ITEM_FLAGS.DOGIF_NO_URL
member.summary: If the source data object does not contain data in the CFSTR_SHELLIDLIST format, which identifies the object through an IDList, do not revert to the CFSTR_INETURL clipboard format, which uses a URL, as an alternative in the transfer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DATAOBJ_GET_ITEM_FLAGS.DOGIF_ONLY_IF_ONE
member.summary: If the source object is an array of items, use it only if the array contains just one item.

member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type and returns an integer that indicates whether the current instance precedes, follows, or occurs in the same position in the sort order as the other object.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CoreShellFolder.ExecCommand(ShellBoost.Core.IWithIdList,System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Object,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OLECMDEXECOPT,System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the specified command. Depends on the folder's IOleCommandTarget optional implementation. The list of supported types for Input is limited to integral types (String, Int32, int64, Boolean, Single, Double, Guid, DateTime,Decimal) and IDictionary types. Values for an IDictionary passed as Input can also contain arrays of aforementioned types.
member.param: A shell item id. Can be null.
An optional input argument. Depends on the command group and identifier.
true to throw error; otherwise false.
member.returns: An output argument. Depends on the command group and identifier. Can be null.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CoreShellFolder.ExecCommand(System.IntPtr,System.Guid,System.Int32,System.Object,ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OLECMDEXECOPT,System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IBindCtx,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the specified command. Depends on the folder's IOleCommandTarget optional implementation. The list of supported types for Input is limited to integral types (String, Int32, int64, Boolean, Single, Double, Guid, DateTime,Decimal) and IDictionary types. Values for an IDictionary passed as Input can also contain arrays of aforementioned types.
member.param: A child pidl. Can be IntPtr.Zero.
An optional input argument. Depends on the command group and identifier.
true to throw error; otherwise false.
member.returns: An output value. Depends on the command group and identifier. Can be null.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS
member.summary: Specifies possible status values used in the System.SyncTransferStatus property.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_NONE
member.summary: There is no current sync activity.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_NEEDSUPLOAD
member.summary: The file is pending upload.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_NEEDSDOWNLOAD
member.summary: The file is pending download.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_TRANSFERRING
member.summary: The file is currently being uploaded or downloaded.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_PAUSED
member.summary: The current transfer is paused.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_HASERROR
member.summary: An error was encountered during the last sync operation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_FETCHING_METADATA
member.summary: The sync engine is retrieving metadata from the cloud.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_USER_REQUESTED_REFRESH
member.summary: The user requested a file refresh.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_HASWARNING
member.summary: The file has warning.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_EXCLUDED
member.summary: The file is excluded.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_INCOMPLETE
member.summary: The file is incomplete.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SYNC_TRANSFER_STATUS.STS_PLACEHOLDER_IFEMPTY
member.summary: The file is a placeholder if empty.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM
member.summary: Flags that specify to position the shortcut menu.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_LEFTBUTTON
member.summary: The user can select menu items with only the left mouse button.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_RIGHTBUTTON
member.summary: The user can select menu items with both the left and right mouse buttons.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_LEFTALIGN
member.summary: Positions the shortcut menu so that its left side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the x parameter.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_CENTERALIGN
member.summary: Centers the shortcut menu horizontally relative to the coordinate specified by the x parameter.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_RIGHTALIGN
member.summary: Positions the shortcut menu so that its right side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the x parameter.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_TOPALIGN
member.summary: Positions the shortcut menu so that its top side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the y parameter.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_VCENTERALIGN
member.summary: Centers the shortcut menu vertically relative to the coordinate specified by the y parameter.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_BOTTOMALIGN
member.summary: Positions the shortcut menu so that its bottom side is aligned with the coordinate specified by the y parameter.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_HORIZONTAL
member.summary: If the pop-up window cannot be shown at the specified location without overlapping the excluded rectangle, the system tries to accommodate the requested horizontal alignment before the requested vertical alignment.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_VERTICAL
member.summary: If the pop-up window cannot be shown at the specified location without overlapping the excluded rectangle, the system tries to accommodate the requested vertical alignment before the requested horizontal alignment.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_NONOTIFY
member.summary: The function does not send notification messages when the user clicks a menu item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_RETURNCMD
member.summary: The function returns the menu item identifier of the user's selection in the return value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_RECURSE
member.summary: Indicates that this is a pop-up menu for a pop-up menu.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_HORPOSANIMATION
member.summary: Animates the menu from left to right.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_HORNEGANIMATION
member.summary: Animates the menu from right to left.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_VERPOSANIMATION
member.summary: Animates the menu from top to bottom.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_VERNEGANIMATION
member.summary: Animates the menu from bottom to top.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_NOANIMATION
member.summary: Displays menu without animation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_LAYOUTRTL
member.summary: To enable right-to-left text layout.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.TPM.TPM_WORKAREA
member.summary: Restricts the pop-up window to within the work area. If this flag is not set, the pop-up window is restricted to the work area only if the input point is within the work area.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWOPTIONS
member.summary: Used the FolderView.SetOptions method to activate Windows Vista options not supported by default in Windows 7 and later systems as well as deactivating new Windows 7 options. Maps to Windows' FOLDERVIEWOPTIONS enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWOPTIONS.FVO_DEFAULT
member.summary: Do not use any special options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWOPTIONS.FVO_VISTALAYOUT
member.summary: Use the Windows Vista list view. This can be used to maintain continuity between systems so that users are presented with an expected view. At this time, setting this flag has the effective, though not literal, result of the application of the FVO_CUSTOMPOSITION and FVO_CUSTOMORDERING flags. However, this could change. Applications should be specific about the behaviors that they require. For instance, if an application requires custom positioning of its items, it should not rely on FVO_VISTALAYOUT to provide it, but instead explicitly apply the FVO_CUSTOMPOSITION flag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWOPTIONS.FVO_CUSTOMPOSITION
member.summary: Items require custom positioning within the space of the view. Those items are positioned to specific coordinates. This option is not active by default in the Windows 7 view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWOPTIONS.FVO_CUSTOMORDERING
member.summary: Items require custom ordering within the view. This option is not active by default in the Windows 7 view. When it is active, the user can reorder the view by dragging items to their desired locations.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWOPTIONS.FVO_SUPPORTHYPERLINKS
member.summary: Tiles and Details displays can contain hyperlinks. This option is not active by default in the Windows 7 view. When hyperlinks are displayed, they are updated to the Windows 7 view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWOPTIONS.FVO_NOANIMATIONS
member.summary: Do not display animations in the view. This option was introduced in Windows 7 and is active by default in the Windows 7 view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWOPTIONS.FVO_NOSCROLLTIPS
member.summary: Do not show scroll tips. This option was introduced in Windows 7 and is active by default in the Windows 7 view.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS
member.summary: Indicates constants that are used in the EditFlags value of a file association PROGID registry key.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_None
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_Exclude
member.summary: Excludes (hides) the file type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_Show
member.summary: Shows file types, such as folders, that are not associated with a file name extension.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_HasExtension
member.summary: Indicates that the file type has a file name extension.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoEdit
member.summary: Prohibits editing of the registry entries associated with this file type, the addition of new entries, and the deletion or modification of existing entries.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoRemove
member.summary: Prohibits deletion of the registry entries associated with this file type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoNewVerb
member.summary: Prohibits the addition of new verbs to the file type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoEditVerb
member.summary: Prohibits the modification or deletion of canonical verbs such as open and print.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoRemoveVerb
member.summary: Prohibits the deletion of canonical verbs such as open and print.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoEditDesc
member.summary: Prohibits the modification or deletion of the description of the file type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoEditIcon
member.summary: Prohibits the modification or deletion of the icon assigned to the file type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoEditDflt
member.summary: Prohibits the modification of the default verb.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoEditVerbCmd
member.summary: Prohibits the modification of the commands associated with verbs.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoEditVerbExe
member.summary: Prohibits the modification or deletion of verbs.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoDDE
member.summary: Prohibits the modification or deletion of the entries related to DDE.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoEditMIME
member.summary: Prohibits the modification or deletion of the content type and default extension entries.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_OpenIsSafe
member.summary: Indicates that the file type's open verb can be safely invoked for downloaded files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_AlwaysUnsafe
member.summary: Prevents the Never ask me check box from being enabled.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_NoRecentDocs
member.summary: Prohibits the addition of members of this file type to the Recent Documents folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_SafeForElevation
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. Marks the file as safe to be passed from a low trust application to a full trust application.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILETYPEATTRIBUTEFLAGS.FTA_AlwaysUseDirectInvoke
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. Ensures that the verbs for the file type are invoked with a URI instead of a downloaded version of the file.

member.summary: Specifies the height, in logical units, of the font's character cell or character.

member.summary: Specifies the average width, in logical units, of characters in the font.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfEscapement
member.summary: Specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between the escapement vector and the x-axis of the device.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between each character's base line and the x-axis of the device.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfWeight
member.summary: Specifies the weight of the font in the range 0 through 1000. For example, 400 is normal and 700 is bold. If this value is zero, a default weight is used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfItalic
member.summary: Non zero to specify an italic font.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfUnderline
member.summary: Non zero to specify an underlined font.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfStrikeOut
member.summary: Non zero to specify a strikeout font.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfCharSet
member.summary: Specifies the character set.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfOutPrecision
member.summary: Specifies the output precision.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfClipPrecision
member.summary: Specifies the clipping precision.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfQuality
member.summary: Specifies the output quality.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfPitchAndFamily
member.summary: Specifies the pitch and group of the font.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.LOGFONT.lfFaceName
member.summary: A string that specifies the typeface name of the font.

member.summary: The previous sibling item of the given item.

member.summary: The parent item of the given item.

member.summary: The first child item of the given item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_FIRSTVISIBLE
member.summary: The absolute first visible item in the tree (not relative to the given item).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.NSTCGNI.NSTCGNI_LASTVISIBLE
member.summary: The absolute last visible item in the tree (not relative to the given item).

member.summary: No options

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OFASI.OFASI_EDIT
member.summary: Select an item and put its name in edit mode. This flag can only be used when a single item is being selected. For multiple item selections, it is ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OFASI.OFASI_OPENDESKTOP
member.summary: Select the item or items on the desktop rather than in a Windows Explorer window Note that if the desktop is obscured behind open windows, it will not be made visible.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OFASI.OFASI_OPENFOLDER
member.summary: Don't select parent folder, just open it w/o selecting any child item.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OLECMDEXECOPT
member.summary: Specifies command execution options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OLECMDEXECOPT.OLECMDEXECOPT_DODEFAULT
member.summary: Prompt the user for input or not, whichever is the default behavior.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OLECMDEXECOPT.OLECMDEXECOPT_PROMPTUSER
member.summary: Execute the command after obtaining user input.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OLECMDEXECOPT.OLECMDEXECOPT_DONTPROMPTUSER
member.summary: Execute the command without prompting the user. For example, clicking the Print toolbar button causes a document to be immediately printed without user input.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.OLECMDEXECOPT.OLECMDEXECOPT_SHOWHELP
member.summary: Show help for the corresponding command, but do not execute.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP
member.summary: Flags specifying options to browse.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_DEFBROWSER
member.summary: Use default behavior, which respects the view option (the user setting to create new windows or to browse in place). In most cases, calling applications should use this flag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_SAMEBROWSER
member.summary: Browse to another folder with the same Windows Explorer window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_NEWBROWSER
member.summary: Creates another window for the specified folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_DEFMODE
member.summary: Use the current window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_OPENMODE
member.summary: Specifies no folder tree for the new browse window. If the current browser does not match the SBSP_OPENMODE of the browse object call, a new window is opened.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_EXPLOREMODE
member.summary: Specifies a folder tree for the new browse window. If the current browser does not match the SBSP_EXPLOREMODE of the browse object call, a new window is opened.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_HELPMODE
member.summary: Not supported. Do not use.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_NOTRANSFERHIST
member.summary: Do not transfer the browsing history to the new window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_ABSOLUTE
member.summary: An absolute PIDL, relative to the desktop.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_RELATIVE
member.summary: A relative PIDL, relative to the current folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_PARENT
member.summary: Browse the parent folder, ignore the PIDL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_NAVIGATEBACK
member.summary: Navigate back, ignore the PIDL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_NAVIGATEFORWARD
member.summary: Navigate forward, ignore the PIDL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_ALLOW_AUTONAVIGATE
member.summary: Enable auto-navigation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_KEEPSAMETEMPLATE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Not supported. Do not use.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_KEEPWORDWHEELTEXT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Navigate without clearing the search entry field.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_ACTIVATE_NOFOCUS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Navigate without the default behavior of setting focus into the new view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_CREATENOHISTORY
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Do not add a new entry to the travel log. When the user enters a search term in the search box and subsequently refines the query, the browser navigates forward but does not add an additional travel log entry.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_PLAYNOSOUND
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Do not make the navigation complete sound for each keystroke in the search box.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_CALLERUNTRUSTED
member.summary: he navigation was possibly initiated by a webpage with scripting code already present on the local system.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_TRUSTFIRSTDOWNLOAD
member.summary: The new window is the result of a user initiated action. Trust the new window if it immediately attempts to download content.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_UNTRUSTEDFORDOWNLOAD
member.summary: The window is navigating to an untrusted, non-HTML file. If the user attempts to download the file, do not allow the download.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_NOAUTOSELECT
member.summary: Suppress selection in the history pane.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_WRITENOHISTORY
member.summary: Write no history of this navigation in the history Shell folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_TRUSTEDFORACTIVEX
member.summary: The navigate should allow ActiveX prompts.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_FEEDNAVIGATION
member.summary: If allowed by current registry settings, give the browser a destination to navigate to.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_REDIRECT
member.summary: Enables redirection to another URL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SBSP.SBSP_INITIATEDBYHLINKFRAME
member.summary: Initiated by hyperlink frame.
