member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB
member.summary: Defines options for the SHGetViewStatePropertyBag method.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_NONE
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_PERUSER
member.summary: Returns the per-user properties for the specified pidl.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_ALLUSERS
member.summary: Returns the All User properties for the specified pidl.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_PERFOLDER
member.summary: Returns the property bag for the folder specified by the pidl parameter.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_ALLFOLDERS
member.summary: Returns the property bag that applies to all folders.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_INHERIT
member.summary: Returns the property bag used to provide defaults for subfolders that do not have their property bag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_ROAM
member.summary: Allows the property bag to roam. This flag cannot be combined with SHGVSPB_ALLFOLDERS.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_NOAUTODEFAULTS
member.summary: Suppresses the search for a suitable default when the property bag cannot be found for the specified folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_FOLDER
member.summary: Combines SHGVSPB_PERUSER and SHGVSPB_PERFOLDER.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_FOLDERNODEFAULTS
member.summary: Combines SHGVSPB_PERUSER, SHGVSPB_PERFOLDER, and SHGVSPB_NOAUTODEFAULTS.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_USERDEFAULTS
member.summary: Combines SHGVSPB_PERUSER and SHGVSPB_ALLFOLDERS.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SHGVSPB.SHGVSPB_GLOBALDEFAULTS
member.summary: Combines SHGVSPB_ALLUSERS and SHGVSPB_ALLFOLDERS.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINTF
member.summary: Used to determine how to compare two Shell items.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINTF.SICHINT_DISPLAY
member.summary: Indicates that the comparison is based on the display in a folder view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINTF.SICHINT_ALLFIELDS
member.summary: Exact comparison of two instances of a Shell item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINTF.SICHINT_CANONICAL
member.summary: Indicates that the comparison is based on a canonical name.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SICHINTF.SICHINT_TEST_FILESYSPATH_IF_NOT_EQUAL
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. If the Shell items are not the same, test the file system paths.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF
member.summary: A set of flags that specify how an image will be extracted Maps to Windows' SIIGBF enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_RESIZETOFIT
member.summary: Shrink the bitmap as necessary to fit, preserving its aspect ratio.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_BIGGERSIZEOK
member.summary: Passed by callers if they want to stretch the returned image themselves.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_MEMORYONLY
member.summary: Return the item only if it is already in memory. Note that this only returns an already-cached icon and can fall back to a per-class icon if an item has a per-instance icon that has not been cached.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_ICONONLY
member.summary: Return only the icon, never the thumbnail.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_THUMBNAILONLY
member.summary: Return only the thumbnail, never the icon. Note that not all items have thumbnails, so SIIGBF_THUMBNAILONLY will cause the method to fail in these cases.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_INCACHEONLY
member.summary: Allows access to the disk, but only to retrieve a cached item. This returns a cached thumbnail if it is available. If no cached thumbnail is available, it returns a cached per-instance icon but does not extract a thumbnail or icon.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_CROPTOSQUARE
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. If necessary, crop the bitmap to a square.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_WIDETHUMBNAILS
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. Stretch and crop the bitmap to a 0.7 aspect ratio.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_ICONBACKGROUND
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. If returning an icon, paint a background using the associated app's registered background color.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SIIGBF.SIIGBF_SCALEUP
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. If necessary, stretch the bitmap so that the height and width fit the given size.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR
member.summary: Values that are using for Shell link resolution.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_NONE
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_NO_UI
member.summary: Do not display a dialog box if the link cannot be resolved.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_ANY_MATCH
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_UPDATE
member.summary: If the link object has changed, update its path and list of identifiers.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_NOUPDATE
member.summary: Do not update the link information.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_NOSEARCH
member.summary: Do not execute the search heuristics.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_NOTRACK
member.summary: Do not use distributed link tracking.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_NOLINKINFO
member.summary: Disable distributed link tracking.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_INVOKE_MSI
member.summary: Call the Windows Installer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_NO_UI_WITH_MSG_PUMP
member.summary: Windows XP and later.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_OFFER_DELETE_WITHOUT_FILE
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Offer the option to delete the shortcut when this method is unable to resolve it, even if the shortcut is not a shortcut to a file.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_KNOWNFOLDER
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Report as dirty if the target is a known folder and the known folder was redirected.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_MACHINE_IN_LOCAL_TARGET
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Resolve the computer name in UNC targets that point to a local computer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_UPDATE_MACHINE_AND_SID
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Update the computer GUID and user SID if necessary.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SLR.SLR_NO_OBJECT_ID
member.summary: Not documented.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SORTCOLUMN
member.summary: Stores information about how to sort a column that is displayed in the folder view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SORTCOLUMN.propkey
member.summary: The PropertyKey of the column by which the items are sorted.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SORTCOLUMN.direction
member.summary: The direction in which the items are sorted.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.SORTCOLUMN.ToString
member.summary: Converts to string.
member.returns: A that represents this instance.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS
member.summary: Defines where to obtain association data and the form the data is stored in for the AssociationElement type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_SHELL_KEY
member.summary: The hkClass member names a key found as HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\SystemFileAssociations. Unused by ShellBoost.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_PROGID_KEY
member.summary: The hkClass member provides the full registry path of a ProgID. Unused by ShellBoost.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_PROGID_STR
member.summary: The Class property names a ProgID found as HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Class.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_CLSID_KEY
member.summary: The hkClass member provides the full registry path of a CLSID. Unused by ShellBoost.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_CLSID_STR
member.summary: The Class property names a CLSID found as HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\CLSID\Class.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_APP_KEY
member.summary: The hkClass member provides the full registry path of an application identifier (APPID). Unused by ShellBoost.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_APP_STR
member.summary: The APPID storing the application information is found at HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Applications\FileName where FileName is obtained by sending the Class property to PathFindFileName.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_SYSTEM_STR
member.summary: The Class property names a key found as HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\SystemFileAssociations\Class.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_FOLDER
member.summary: Use the association information for folders stored under HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Folder. When this flag is set, the Class property is ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_STAR
member.summary: Use the association information stored under the HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\* subkey. When this flag is set, the Class property ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_FIXED_PROGID_STR
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. Do not use the user defaults to apply the mapping of the class specified by the Class property.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.ASSOCCLASS.ASSOCCLASS_PROTOCOL_STR
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. Use the user defaults to apply the mapping of the class specified by the Class property; the class is a protocol.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants
member.summary: Contains values used by the Navigate and Navigate2 methods of Shell Windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navOpenInNewWindow
member.summary: Open the resource or file in a new window.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navNoHistory
member.summary: Do not add the resource or file to the history list. The new page replaces the current page in the list.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navNoReadFromCache
member.summary: Not implemented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navNoWriteToCache
member.summary: Not implemented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navAllowAutosearch
member.summary: If the navigation fails, the autosearch functionality attempts to navigate common root domains (.com, .edu, and so on). If this also fails, the URL is passed to a search engine.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navBrowserBar
member.summary: Causes the current Explorer Bar to navigate to the given item, if possible.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navHyperlink
member.summary: Microsoft Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later. If the navigation fails when a hyperlink is being followed, this constant specifies that the resource should then be bound to the moniker using the BINDF_HYPERLINK flag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navEnforceRestricted
member.summary: Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP SP2 and later. Force the URL into the restricted zone.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navNewWindowsManaged
member.summary: Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP SP2 and later. Use the default Popup Manager to block pop-up windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navUntrustedForDownload
member.summary: Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP SP2 and later. Block files that normally trigger a file download dialog box.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navTrustedForActiveX
member.summary: Internet Explorer 6 for Windows XP SP2 and later. Prompt for the installation of Microsoft ActiveX controls.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navOpenInNewTab
member.summary: Windows Internet Explorer 7. Open the resource or file in a new tab. Allow the destination window to come to the foreground, if necessary.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navOpenInBackgroundTab
member.summary: Internet Explorer 7. Open the resource or file in a new background tab; the currently active window and/or tab remains open on top.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navKeepWordWheelText
member.summary: Internet Explorer 7. Maintain state for dynamic navigation based on the filter string entered in the search band text box (wordwheel). Restore the wordwheel text when the navigation completes.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navVirtualTab
member.summary: Internet Explorer 8. Open the resource as a replacement for the current or target tab. The existing tab is closed while the new tab takes its place in the tab bar and replaces it in the tab group, if any. Browser history is copied forward to the new tab. On Windows Vista, this flag is implied if the navigation would cross integrity levels and navOpenInNewTab, navOpenInBackgroundTab, or navOpenInNewWindow is not specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navBlockRedirectsXDomain
member.summary: Internet Explorer 8. Block cross-domain redirect requests. The navigation triggers the RedirectXDomainBlocked event if blocked.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navOpenNewForegroundTab
member.summary: Internet Explorer 8 and later. Open the resource in a new tab that becomes the foreground tab.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navTravelLogScreenshot
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navDeferUnload
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navSpeculative
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navSuggestNewWindow
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navSuggestNewTab
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navHomepageNavigate
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navRefresh
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.BrowserNavConstants.navHostNavigation
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CDB2GVF
member.summary: Common dialog browser customization view flags.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CDB2GVF.CDB2GVF_SHOWALLFILES
member.summary: All files, including hidden and system files, should be shown.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CDB2GVF.CDB2GVF_ISFILESAVE
member.summary: This browser is designated to choose a file to save.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CDB2GVF.CDB2GVF_ALLOWPREVIEWPANE
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CDB2GVF.CDB2GVF_NOSELECTVERB
member.summary: Do not show a "select" verb on an item's context menu.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CDB2GVF.CDB2GVF_NOINCLUDEITEM
member.summary: ICommDlgBrowser::IncludeObject should not be called.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CDB2GVF.CDB2GVF_ISFOLDERPICKER
member.summary: This browser is designated to pick folders.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CDB2GVF.CDB2GVF_ADDSHIELD
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Displays a UAC shield on the selected item when CDB2GVF_NOSELECTVERB is not specified.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF
member.summary: Optional flags that specify how a context or shortcut menu can be changed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_NORMAL
member.summary: Indicates normal operation. A shortcut menu extension, namespace extension, or drag-and-drop handler can add all menu items.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_DEFAULTONLY
member.summary: The user is activating the default action, typically by double-clicking. This flag provides a hint for the shortcut menu extension to add nothing if it does not modify the default item in the menu. A shortcut menu extension or drag-and-drop handler should not add any menu items if this value is specified. A namespace extension should at most add only the default item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_VERBSONLY
member.summary: The shortcut menu is that of a shortcut file (normally, a .lnk file). Shortcut menu handlers should ignore this value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_EXPLORE
member.summary: The Windows Explorer tree window is present.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_NOVERBS
member.summary: This flag is set for items displayed in the Send To menu. Shortcut menu handlers should ignore this value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_CANRENAME
member.summary: The calling application supports renaming of items. A shortcut menu or drag-and-drop handler should ignore this flag. A namespace extension should add a Rename item to the menu if applicable.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_NODEFAULT
member.summary: No item in the menu has been set as the default. A drag-and-drop handler should ignore this flag. A namespace extension should not set any of the menu items as the default.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_INCLUDESTATIC
member.summary: This value is not available. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: A static menu is being constructed. Only the browser should use this flag; all other shortcut menu extensions should ignore it.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_ITEMMENU
member.summary: The calling application is invoking a shortcut menu on an item in the view (as opposed to the background of the view). Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not available.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_EXTENDEDVERBS
member.summary: The calling application wants extended verbs. Normal verbs are displayed when the user right-clicks an object. To display extended verbs, the user must right-click while pressing the Shift key.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_DISABLEDVERBS
member.summary: The calling application intends to invoke verbs that are disabled, such as legacy menus. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not available.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_ASYNCVERBSTATE
member.summary: The verb state can be evaluated asynchronously. Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not available.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_OPTIMIZEFORINVOKE
member.summary: Informs context menu handlers that do not support the invocation of a verb through a canonical verb name to bypass IContextMenu::QueryContextMenu in their implementation. Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not available.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_SYNCCASCADEMENU
member.summary: Populate submenus synchronously. Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not available.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_DONOTPICKDEFAULT
member.summary: When no verb is explicitly specified, do not use a default verb in its place. Windows Server 2008, Windows Vista, Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This value is not available.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_UNDOCUMENTED1
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_DVFILE
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_ICM3
member.summary: Undocumented.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMF.CMF_RESERVED
member.summary: This flag is a bitmask that specifies all bits that should not be used. This is to be used only as a mask. Do not use this.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK
member.summary: Flags that specify how to handle the data in the command menu invoke events.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_ASYNCOK
member.summary: Invocation implementation can spin off a new thread or process to handle the call and does not need to block on completion of the function being invoked.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_HOTKEY
member.summary: A hotkey has been specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_ICON
member.summary: An icon handle has been specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_FLAG_NO_UI
member.summary: Invocation implementation is prevented from displaying user interface elements (for example, error messages) while carrying out a command.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_UNICODE
member.summary: Uses unicode strings.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_NO_CONSOLE
member.summary: If a shortcut menu handler needs to create a new process, it normally creates a new console. Setting the CMIC_MASK_NO_CONSOLE flag suppresses the creation of a new console.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_NOASYNC
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Invocation implementation should be synchronous, not returning before it is complete. Since this is recommended, calling applications that specify this flag cannot guarantee that this request will be honored if they are not familiar with the implementation of the verb that they are invoking.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_SHIFT_DOWN
member.summary: The SHIFT key is pressed. Use this instead of polling the current state of the keyboard that may have changed since the verb was invoked.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_CONTROL_DOWN
member.summary: The CTRL key is pressed. Use this instead of polling the current state of the keyboard that may have changed since the verb was invoked.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_FLAG_LOG_USAGE
member.summary: Invocation implementation might want to keep track of the item being invoked for features like the "Recent documents" menu.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_NOZONECHECKS
member.summary: Do not perform a zone check. This flag allows ShellExecuteEx to bypass zone checking put into place by IAttachmentExecute.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CMIC_MASK.CMIC_MASK_PTINVOKE
member.summary: Reserved. Don't use.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CM_SET_WIDTH_VALUE
member.summary: Specifies width values in pixels and includes special support for default and autosize.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CM_SET_WIDTH_VALUE.CM_WIDTH_USEDEFAULT
member.summary: Use the default width.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CM_SET_WIDTH_VALUE.CM_WIDTH_AUTOSIZE
member.summary: Use the auto-size width.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CM_STATE
member.summary: Specifies column state values.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CM_STATE.CM_STATE_NONE
member.summary: The column is not currently displayed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CM_STATE.CM_STATE_VISIBLE
member.summary: The column is currently displayed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CM_STATE.CM_STATE_FIXEDWIDTH
member.summary: The column cannot be resized.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CM_STATE.CM_STATE_NOSORTBYFOLDERNESS
member.summary: Do not sort folders separately.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CM_STATE.CM_STATE_ALWAYSVISIBLE
member.summary: The column cannot be hidden.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL
member.summary: CSIDL (constant special item ID list) values provide a unique system-independent way to identify special folders used frequently by applications, but which may not have the same name or location on any given system. For example, the system folder may be "C:\Windows" on one system and "C:\Winnt" on another.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_DESKTOP
member.summary: The virtual folder that represents the Windows desktop, the root of the namespace.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_INTERNET
member.summary: A virtual folder for Internet Explorer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROGRAMS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the user's program groups (which are themselves file system directories). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu\Programs.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_CONTROLS
member.summary: The virtual folder that contains icons for the Control Panel applications.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_PRINTERS
member.summary: The virtual folder that contains installed printers.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_PERSONAL
member.summary: The virtual folder that represents the My Documents desktop item. This is equivalent to CSIDL_MYDOCUMENTS.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_FAVORITES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for the user's favorite items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Favorites.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_STARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the user's Startup program group. The system starts these programs whenever the associated user logs on. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_RECENT
member.summary: The file system directory that contains shortcuts to the user's most recently used documents. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Recent Documents. To create a shortcut in this folder, use SHAddToRecentDocs. In addition to creating the shortcut, this function updates the Shell's list of recent documents and adds the shortcut to the My Recent Documents submenu of the Start menu.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_SENDTO
member.summary: The file system directory that contains Send To menu items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\SendTo.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_BITBUCKET
member.summary: The virtual folder that contains the objects in the user's Recycle Bin.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_STARTMENU
member.summary: The file system directory that contains Start menu items. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Start Menu.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_MYDOCUMENTS
member.summary: The virtual folder that represents the My Documents desktop item. This value is equivalent to CSIDL_PERSONAL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_MYMUSIC
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for music files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\User\My Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_MYVIDEO
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for video files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_DESKTOPDIRECTORY
member.summary: The file system directory used to physically store file objects on the desktop (not to be confused with the desktop folder itself). A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Desktop.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_DRIVES
member.summary: The virtual folder that represents My Computer, containing everything on the local computer: storage devices, printers, and Control Panel. The folder can also contain mapped network drives.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_NETWORK
member.summary: A virtual folder that represents Network Neighborhood, the root of the network namespace hierarchy.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_NETHOOD
member.summary: A file system directory that contains the link objects that may exist in the My Network Places virtual folder. It is not the same as CSIDL_NETWORK, which represents the network namespace root. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\NetHood.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_FONTS
member.summary: A virtual folder that contains fonts. A typical path is C:\Windows\Fonts.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_TEMPLATES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for document templates. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Templates.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_STARTMENU
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs and folders that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_PROGRAMS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the directories for the common program groups that appear on the Start menu for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_STARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the programs that appear in the Startup folder for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Start Menu\Programs\Startup.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_DESKTOPDIRECTORY
member.summary: The file system directory that contains files and folders that appear on the desktop for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Desktop.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_APPDATA
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for application-specific data. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Application Data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_PRINTHOOD
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the link objects that can exist in the Printers virtual folder. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\PrintHood.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_LOCAL_APPDATA
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a data repository for local (nonroaming) applications. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_ALTSTARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the user's nonlocalized Startup program group. This value is recognized in Windows Vista for backward compatibility, but the folder itself no longer exists.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_ALTSTARTUP
member.summary: The file system directory that corresponds to the nonlocalized Startup program group for all users. This value is recognized in Windows Vista for backward compatibility, but the folder itself no longer exists.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_FAVORITES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for favorite items common to all users.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_INTERNET_CACHE
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for temporary Internet files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Temporary Internet Files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COOKIES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet cookies. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Cookies.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_HISTORY
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for Internet history items.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_APPDATA
member.summary: The file system directory that contains application data for all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Application Data. This folder is used for application data that is not user specific. For example, an application can store a spell-check dictionary, a database of clip art, or a log file in the CSIDL_COMMON_APPDATA folder. This information will not roam and is available to anyone using the computer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_WINDOWS
member.summary: The Windows directory or SYSROOT. This corresponds to the %windir% or %SYSTEMROOT% environment variables. A typical path is C:\Windows.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_SYSTEM
member.summary: The Windows System folder. A typical path is C:\Windows\System32.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROGRAM_FILES
member.summary: The Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_MYPICTURES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a common repository for image files. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROFILE
member.summary: The user's profile folder. A typical path is C:\Users\username. Applications should not create files or folders at this level; they should put their data under the locations referred to by CSIDL_APPDATA or CSIDL_LOCAL_APPDATA. However, if you are creating a new Known Folder the profile root referred to by CSIDL_PROFILE is appropriate.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_SYSTEMX86
member.summary: The x86 Windows System folder. A typical path is C:\Windows\SysWOW64.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROGRAM_FILESX86
member.summary: The x86 Program Files folder. A typical path is C:\Program Files (X86).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROGRAM_FILES_COMMON
member.summary: A folder for components that are shared across applications. A typical path is C:\Program Files\Common. Valid only for Windows XP.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_PROGRAM_FILES_COMMONX86
member.summary: A folder for components that are shared across x86 applications. A typical path is C:\Program Files (x86)\Common. Valid only for Windows XP.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_TEMPLATES
member.summary: The file system directory that contains the templates that are available to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Templates.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_DOCUMENTS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains documents that are common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_ADMINTOOLS
member.summary: The file system directory that contains administrative tools for all users of the computer.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_ADMINTOOLS
member.summary: The file system directory that is used to store administrative tools for an individual user. The MMC will save customized consoles to this directory, and it will roam with the user.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_CONNECTIONS
member.summary: The virtual folder that represents Network Connections, that contains network and dial-up connections.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_MUSIC
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for music files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Music.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_PICTURES
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for image files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Pictures.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_VIDEO
member.summary: The file system directory that serves as a repository for video files common to all users. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\All Users\Documents\My Videos.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_RESOURCES
member.summary: Windows Vista. The file system directory that contains resource data. A typical path is C:\Windows\Resources.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_RESOURCES_LOCALIZED
member.summary: Windows Vista. The file system directory that contains localized resource data..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMMON_OEM_LINKS
member.summary: This value is recognized in Windows Vista for backward compatibility, but the folder itself is no longer used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_CDBURN_AREA
member.summary: The file system directory that acts as a staging area for files waiting to be written to a CD. A typical path is C:\Documents and Settings\username\Local Settings\Application Data\Microsoft\CD Burning.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.CSIDL.CSIDL_COMPUTERSNEARME
member.summary: The folder that represents other computers in your workgroup.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD
member.summary: Defines some well-known command identifiers for context menus.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_DELETE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Delete the current item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_MOVE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Move the current item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_COPY
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Copy the current item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_LINK
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Create a link to the current item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_PROPERTIES
member.summary: Show the Properties UI for the item on which the menu was invoked.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_NEWFOLDER
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_PASTE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Paste an item to the current location.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_VIEWLIST
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_VIEWDETAILS
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_PASTELINK
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Paste a link at the current location.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_PASTESPECIAL
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_MODALPROP
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DFM_CMD.DFM_CMD_RENAME
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Rename the current item.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DROPEFFECT
member.summary: Represents information about the effects of a drag-and-drop operation. Maps to Windows' DROPEFFECT Constants.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DROPEFFECT.DROPEFFECT_NONE
member.summary: Drop target cannot accept the data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DROPEFFECT.DROPEFFECT_COPY
member.summary: Drop results in a copy. The original data is untouched by the drag source.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DROPEFFECT.DROPEFFECT_MOVE
member.summary: Drag source should remove the data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.DROPEFFECT.DROPEFFECT_LINK
member.summary: Drag source should create a link to the original data.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.EXPLORERPANESTATE
member.summary: Indicate flags used to get the current state of the given Windows Explorer pane. Maps to Windows' EXPLORERPANESTATE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.EXPLORERPANESTATE.EPS_DONTCARE
member.summary: Do not make any modifications to the pane.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.EXPLORERPANESTATE.EPS_DEFAULT_ON
member.summary: Set the default state of the pane to "on", but respect any user-modified persisted state.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.EXPLORERPANESTATE.EPS_DEFAULT_OFF
member.summary: Set the default state of the pane to "off".

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.EXPLORERPANESTATE.EPS_INITIALSTATE
member.summary: Ignore any persisted state from the user, but the user can still modify the state.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.EXPLORERPANESTATE.EPS_FORCE
member.summary: Users cannot modify the state, that is, they do not have the ability to show or hide the given pane. This option implies EPS_INITIALSTATE.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD
member.summary: Indicates which of the other structure members contain valid data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_CLSID
member.summary: The clsid member is valid.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_SIZEPOINT
member.summary: The sizel and pointl members are valid.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: The dwFileAttributes member is valid.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_CREATETIME
member.summary: The ftCreationTime member is valid.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_ACCESSTIME
member.summary: The ftLastAccessTime member is valid.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_WRITESTIME
member.summary: The ftLastWriteTime member is valid.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_FILESIZE
member.summary: The nFileSizeHigh and nFileSizeLow members are valid.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_PROGRESSUI
member.summary: A progress indicator is shown with drag-and-drop operations.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_LINKUI
member.summary: Treat the operation as a shortcut.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FD.FD_UNICODE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The descriptor is Unicode.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FDE_OVERWRITE_RESPONSE
member.summary: Specifies the values used by the OverwriteFileDialogEventArgs Response property to indicate an application's response to an overwrite request during a save operation using the common file dialog. Maps to Windows' FDE_OVERWRITE_RESPONSE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FDE_OVERWRITE_RESPONSE.FDEOR_DEFAULT
member.summary: The application has not handled the event. The dialog displays a UI asking the user whether the file should be overwritten and returned from the dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FDE_OVERWRITE_RESPONSE.FDEOR_ACCEPT
member.summary: The application has determined that the file should be returned from the dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FDE_OVERWRITE_RESPONSE.FDEOR_REFUSE
member.summary: The application has determined that the file should not be returned from the dialog.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FDE_SHAREVIOLATION_RESPONSE
member.summary: Specifies the values used by the ShareViolationFileDialogEventArgs Response property to indicate an application's response to a sharing violation that occurs when a file is opened or saved. Maps to Windows' FDE_SHAREVIOLATION_RESPONSE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FDE_SHAREVIOLATION_RESPONSE.FDESVR_DEFAULT
member.summary: The application has not handled the event. The dialog displays a UI that indicates that the file is in use and a different file must be chosen.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FDE_SHAREVIOLATION_RESPONSE.FDESVR_ACCEPT
member.summary: The application has determined that the file should be returned from the dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FDE_SHAREVIOLATION_RESPONSE.FDESVR_REFUSE
member.summary: The application has determined that the file should not be returned from the dialog.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FFFP_MODE
member.summary: Describes match criteria for known folder search.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FFFP_MODE.FFFP_EXACTMATCH
member.summary: Exact match.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FFFP_MODE.FFFP_NEARESTPARENTMATCH
member.summary: Nearest parent match.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR
member.summary: Describes the properties of a file that is being copied by means of the clipboard during a drag-and-drop operation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.dwFlags
member.summary: Flags that indicate which of the other structure members contain valid data.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.clsid
member.summary: The file type identifier.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.sizel
member.summary: The width and height of the file icon.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.pointl
member.summary: The screen coordinates of the file object.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.dwFileAttributes
member.summary: File attribute flags.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.ftCreationTime
member.summary: The FILETIME structure that contains the time of file creation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.ftLastAccessTime
member.summary: The FILETIME structure that contains the time that the file was last accessed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.ftLastWriteTime
member.summary: The FILETIME structure that contains the time of the last write operation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.nFileSizeHigh
member.summary: The high-order DWORD of the file size, in bytes.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.nFileSizeLow
member.summary: The low-order DWORD of the file size, in bytes.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.cFileName
member.summary: The string that contains the name of the file.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.ToString

member.summary: Creates a descriptor from a PIDL.

member.name: M:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEDESCRIPTOR.FromFileInfo(System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Creates a descriptor from a FileInfo instance.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS
member.summary: Specifies the values used by the ShareViolationFileDialogEventArgs Response property to indicate an application's response to a sharing violation that occurs when a file is opened or saved. Maps to Windows' FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_OVERWRITEPROMPT
member.summary: When saving a file, prompt before overwriting an existing file of the same name. This is a default value for the Save dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_STRICTFILETYPES
member.summary: In the Save dialog, only allow the user to choose a file that has one of the file name extensions specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_NOCHANGEDIR
member.summary: Don't change the current working directory.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_PICKFOLDERS
member.summary: Present an Open dialog that offers a choice of folders rather than files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_FORCEFILESYSTEM
member.summary: Ensures that returned items are file system items (SFGAO_FILESYSTEM).

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_ALLNONSTORAGEITEMS
member.summary: Enables the user to choose any item in the Shell namespace, not just those with SFGAO_STREAM or SFAGO_FILESYSTEM attributes. This flag cannot be combined with FOS_FORCEFILESYSTEM.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_NOVALIDATE
member.summary: Do not check for situations that would prevent an application from opening the selected file, such as sharing violations or access denied errors.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_ALLOWMULTISELECT
member.summary: Enables the user to select multiple items in the open dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_PATHMUSTEXIST
member.summary: The item returned must be in an existing folder. This is a default value.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_FILEMUSTEXIST
member.summary: The item returned must exist. This is a default value for the Open dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_CREATEPROMPT
member.summary: Prompt for creation if the item returned in the save dialog does not exist. Note that this does not actually create the item.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_SHAREAWARE
member.summary: In the case of a sharing violation when an application is opening a file. This flag is overridden by FOS_NOVALIDATE.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_NOREADONLYRETURN
member.summary: Do not return read-only items. This is a default value for the Save dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_NOTESTFILECREATE
member.summary: Do not test whether creation of the item as specified in the Save dialog will be successful. If this flag is not set, the calling application must handle errors, such as denial of access, discovered when the item is created.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_HIDEMRUPLACES
member.summary: Hide the list of places from which the user has recently opened or saved items. This value is not supported as of Windows 7.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_HIDEPINNEDPLACES
member.summary: Hide items shown by default in the view's navigation pane. This flag is often used in conjunction with the IFileDialog::AddPlace method, to hide standard locations and replace them with custom locations. Windows 7 and later. Hide all of the standard namespace locations (such as Favorites, Libraries, Computer, and Network) shown in the navigation pane. Windows Vista.Hide the contents of the Favorite Links tree in the navigation pane.Note that the category itself is still displayed, but shown as empty.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_NODEREFERENCELINKS
member.summary: Shortcuts should not be treated as their target items. This allows an application to open a .lnk file rather than what that file is a shortcut to.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_OKBUTTONNEEDSINTERACTION
member.summary: Only enable the OK button if the user has done something in the view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_DONTADDTORECENT
member.summary: Do not add the item being opened or saved to the recent documents list.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_FORCESHOWHIDDEN
member.summary: Include hidden and system items.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_DEFAULTNOMINIMODE
member.summary: Indicates to the Save As dialog box that it should open in expanded mode. Expanded mode is the mode that is set and unset by clicking the button in the lower-left corner of the Save As dialog box that switches between Browse Folders and Hide Folders when clicked. This value is not supported as of Windows 7.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_FORCEPREVIEWPANEON
member.summary: Indicates to the Open dialog box that the preview pane should always be displayed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FILEOPENDIALOGOPTIONS.FOS_SUPPORTSTREAMABLEITEMS
member.summary: Indicates that the caller is opening a file as a stream, so there is no need to download that file.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF
member.summary: Flags that control file operations.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_MULTIDESTFILES
member.summary: The target specifies multiple destination files (one for each source file in pFrom) rather than one directory where all source files are to be deposited.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_CONFIRMMOUSE
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_SILENT
member.summary: Do not display a progress dialog box.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_RENAMEONCOLLISION
member.summary: Give the file being operated on a new name in a move, copy, or rename operation if a file with the target name already exists at the destination.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_NOCONFIRMATION
member.summary: Respond with Yes to All for any dialog box that is displayed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_WANTMAPPINGHANDLE
member.summary: If FOF_RENAMEONCOLLISION is specified and any files were renamed, assign a name mapping object that contains their old and new names to the hNameMappings member. This object must be freed using SHFreeNameMappings when it is no longer needed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_ALLOWUNDO
member.summary: Preserve undo information, if possible. Prior to Windows Vista, operations could be undone only from the same process that performed the original operation. In Windows Vista and later systems, the scope of the undo is a user session. Any process running in the user session can undo another operation. The undo state is held in the Explorer.exe process, and as long as that process is running, it can coordinate the undo functions.If the source file parameter does not contain fully qualified path and file names, this flag is ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_FILESONLY
member.summary: Perform the operation only on files (not on folders) if a wildcard file name (*.*) is specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_SIMPLEPROGRESS
member.summary: Display a progress dialog box but do not show individual file names as they are operated on.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_NOCONFIRMMKDIR
member.summary: Do not ask the user to confirm the creation of a new directory if the operation requires one to be created.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_NOERRORUI
member.summary: Do not display a dialog to the user if an error occurs.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_NOCOPYSECURITYATTRIBS
member.summary: Do not copy the security attributes of the file. The destination file receives the security attributes of its new folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_NORECURSION
member.summary: Only perform the operation in the local directory. Do not operate recursively into subdirectories, which is the default behavior.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_NO_CONNECTED_ELEMENTS
member.summary: Do not move connected files as a group. Only move the specified files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_WANTNUKEWARNING
member.summary: Send a warning if a file is being permanently destroyed during a delete operation rather than recycled. This flag partially overrides FOF_NOCONFIRMATION.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_NORECURSEREPARSE
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOF_NO_UI
member.summary: Windows Vista. Perform the operation silently, presenting no UI to the user. This is equivalent to FOF_SILENT | FOF_NOCONFIRMATION | FOF_NOERRORUI | FOF_NOCONFIRMMKDIR.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_NOSKIPJUNCTIONS
member.summary: Walk into Shell namespace junctions. By default, junctions are not entered.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_PREFERHARDLINK
member.summary: If possible, create a hard link rather than a new instance of the file in the destination.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_SHOWELEVATIONPROMPT
member.summary: If an operation requires elevated rights and the FOF_NOERRORUI flag is set to disable error UI, display a UAC UI prompt nonetheless.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_RECYCLEONDELETE
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. When a file is deleted, send it to the Recycle Bin rather than permanently deleting it.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_EARLYFAILURE
member.summary: If FOFX_EARLYFAILURE is set together with FOF_NOERRORUI, the entire set of operations is stopped upon encountering any error in any operation. This flag is valid only when FOF_NOERRORUI is set.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_PRESERVEFILEEXTENSIONS
member.summary: Rename collisions in such a way as to preserve file name extensions. This flag is valid only when FOF_RENAMEONCOLLISION is also set.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_KEEPNEWERFILE
member.summary: Keep the newer file or folder, based on the Date Modified property, if a collision occurs. This is done automatically with no prompt UI presented to the user.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_NOCOPYHOOKS
member.summary: Do not use copy hooks.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_NOMINIMIZEBOX
member.summary: Do not allow the progress dialog to be minimized.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_MOVEACLSACROSSVOLUMES
member.summary: Copy the security attributes of the source item to the destination item when performing a cross-volume move operation. Without this flag, the destination item receives the security attributes of its new folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_DONTDISPLAYSOURCEPATH
member.summary: Do not display the path of the source item in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_DONTDISPLAYDESTPATH
member.summary: Do not display the path of the destination item in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_REQUIREELEVATION
member.summary: Introduced in Windows Vista SP1. The user expects a requirement for rights elevation, so do not display a dialog box asking for a confirmation of the elevation.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_ADDUNDORECORD
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. The file operation was user-invoked and should be placed on the undo stack. This flag is preferred to FOF_ALLOWUNDO.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_COPYASDOWNLOAD
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. Display a Downloading instead of Copying message in the progress dialog.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOF.FOFX_DONTDISPLAYLOCATIONS
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. Do not display the location line in the progress dialog.

member.summary: Get or sets the sort order used for grouping items in the folder display.

member.summary: Gets the width (x) and height (y) dimensions, including the surrounding white space, of an item.
member.value: The width (x) and height (y) dimensions, including the surrounding white space, of an item.

member.summary: Gets the index of the item that currently has focus in the folder's view.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE
member.summary: Specifies the folder view type. Maps to Windows' FOLDERVIEWMODE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_AUTO
member.summary: The view should determine the best option.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_ICON
member.summary: The view should display medium-size icons.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_SMALLICON
member.summary: The view should display small icons.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_LIST
member.summary: Object names are displayed in a list view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_DETAILS
member.summary: Object names and other selected information, such as the size or date last updated, are shown.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_THUMBNAIL
member.summary: The view should display thumbnail icons.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_TILE
member.summary: The view should display large icons.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_THUMBSTRIP
member.summary: The view should display icons in a filmstrip format.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERVIEWMODE.FVM_CONTENT
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. The view should display content mode.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS
member.summary: A set of flags that specify folder view options. Maps to Windows' FOLDERFLAGS enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NONE
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. No special view options.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_AUTOARRANGE
member.summary: Automatically arrange the elements in the view. This implies LVS_AUTOARRANGE if the list-view control is used to implement the view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_ABBREVIATEDNAMES
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SNAPTOGRID
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_OWNERDATA
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_BESTFITWINDOW
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_DESKTOP
member.summary: Make the folder behave like the desktop. This value applies only to the desktop and is not used for typical Shell folders. This flag implies FWF_NOCLIENTEDGE and FWF_NOSCROLL.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SINGLESEL
member.summary: Do not allow more than a single item to be selected. This is used in the Common Dialog boxes.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOSUBFOLDERS
member.summary: Do not show subfolders.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Draw transparently. This is used only for the desktop.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOCLIENTEDGE
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOSCROLL
member.summary: Do not add scroll bars. This is used only for the desktop.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_ALIGNLEFT
member.summary: The view should be left-aligned.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOICONS
member.summary: The view should not display icons.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SHOWSELALWAYS
member.summary: This flag is deprecated as of Windows XP and has no effect. Always show the selection.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOVISIBLE
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SINGLECLICKACTIVATE
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOWEBVIEW
member.summary: The view should not be shown as a web view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_HIDEFILENAMES
member.summary: The view should not display file names.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_CHECKSELECT
member.summary: Turns on the check mode for the view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOENUMREFRESH
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Do not re-enumerate the view (or drop the current contents of the view) when the view is refreshed.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOGROUPING
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Do not allow grouping in the view

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_FULLROWSELECT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. When an item is selected, the item and all its sub-items are highlighted.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOFILTERS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Do not display filters in the view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOCOLUMNHEADER
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Do not display a column header in the view in any view mode.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOHEADERINALLVIEWS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Only show the column header in details view mode.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_EXTENDEDTILES
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. When the view is in "tile view mode" the layout of a single item should be extended to the width of the view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_TRICHECKSELECT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Not supported.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_AUTOCHECKSELECT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Items can be selected using checkboxes.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_NOBROWSERVIEWSTATE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The view should not save view state in the browser.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_SUBSETGROUPS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The view should list the number of items displayed in each group.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_USESEARCHFOLDER
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Use the search folder for stacking and searching.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERFLAGS.FWF_ALLOWRTLREADING
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Ensure right-to-left reading layout in a right-to-left system. Without this flag, the view displays strings from left-to-right both on systems set to left-to-right and right-to-left reading layout, which ensures that file names display correctly.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE
member.summary: Describes a folder view mode. Maps to Windows' FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE enumeration..

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE.FLVM_UNSPECIFIED
member.summary: The view is not specified.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE.FLVM_FIRST
member.summary: The minimum valid enumeration value. Used for validation purposes only.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE.FLVM_DETAILS
member.summary: Details view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE.FLVM_TILES
member.summary: Tiles view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE.FLVM_ICONS
member.summary: Icons view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE.FLVM_LIST
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. List view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE.FLVM_CONTENT
member.summary: Windows 7 and later. Content view.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERLOGICALVIEWMODE.FLVM_LAST
member.summary: The maximum valid enumeration value. Used for validation purposes only.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID
member.summary: The FOLDERTYPEID values represent a view template applied to a folder, usually based on its intended use and contents. Maps to Windows' FOLDERTYPEID.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Invalid
member.summary: The folder is invalid. There are several things that can cause this judgement: hard disk errors, file system errors, and compression errors among them.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Generic
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder does not fall under one of the other FOLDERTYPEID categories.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_GenericSearchResults
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains search results, but they are of mixed or no specific type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_GenericLibrary
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder is a library, but of no specified type.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Documents
member.summary: The folder contains document files. These can be of mixed format—.doc, .txt, and others.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Pictures
member.summary: Image files, such as .jpg, .tif, or .png files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Music
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains audio files, such as .mp3 and .wma files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Videos
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains video files. These can be of mixed format—.wmv, .mov, and others.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_UserFiles
member.summary: The folder is the FOLDERID_UsersFiles folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_UsersLibraries
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The view shown when the user clicks the Windows Explorer button on the taskbar.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_OtherUsers
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_PublishedItems
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. A homegroup user's libraries.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Communications
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. A folder that contains communication-related files such as emails, calendar information, and contact information.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Contacts
member.summary: A folder that contains email contact information.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_StartMenu
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. A user's Start Menu folder, normally found at C:\Users\username\Start Menu.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_RecordedTV
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains recorded television broadcasts.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_SavedGames
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains saved game states.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_OpenSearch
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. The folder contains federated search OpenSearch results.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_SearchConnector
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_AccountPictures
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8. The folder contains the image files used with the current user's account.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Games
member.summary: The folder is the Games folder found in the Start menu.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_ControlPanelCategory
member.summary: The Control Panel in category view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_ControlPanelClassic
member.summary: The Control Panel in classic view. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Printers
member.summary: Printers that have been added to the system. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_RecycleBin
member.summary: The Recycle Bin. This is a virtual folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_SoftwareExplorer
member.summary: The software explorer window used by the Add or Remove Programs control panel icon.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_CompressedFolder
member.summary: The folder is a compressed archive, such as a compressed file with a .zip file name extension.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_NetworkExplorer
member.summary: The Network Explorer folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Searches
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7. A user's Searches folder, normally found at C:\Users\username\Searches.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_SearchHome
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 7.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_StorageProviderGeneric
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8.1. The folder is a MSFT_StorageProvider folder and does not fall under one of the other FOLDERTYPEID categories.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_StorageProviderDocuments
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8.1. The folder is a MSFT_StorageProvider folder and contains document files. These can be of mixed format—.doc, .txt, and others.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_StorageProviderPictures
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8.1. The folder is a MSFT_StorageProvider folder and contains image files, such as .jpg, .tif, or .png files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_StorageProviderMusic
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8.1. The folder is a MSFT_StorageProvider folder and contains audio files, such as .mp3 and .wma files.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_StorageProviderVideos
member.summary: Introduced in Windows 8.1. The folder is a MSFT_StorageProvider folder and contains video files. These can be of mixed format—.wmv, .mov, and others.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.FOLDERTYPEID.FOLDERTYPEID_Home
member.summary: The home folder.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILIN
member.summary: Defines input options used when getting an icon location.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILIN.GIL_NONE
member.summary: No option is defined.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILIN.GIL_OPENICON
member.summary: The icon is in the open state if both open-state and closed-state images are available. If this flag is not specified, the icon is in the normal or closed state. This flag is typically used for folder objects.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILIN.GIL_FORSHELL
member.summary: The icon is displayed in a Shell folder.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILIN.GIL_ASYNC
member.summary: Set this flag to determine whether the icon should be extracted asynchronously. If the icon can be extracted rapidly, this flag is usually ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILIN.GIL_DEFAULTICON
member.summary: Retrieve information about the fallback icon. Fallback icons are usually used while the desired icon is extracted and added to the cache.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILIN.GIL_FORSHORTCUT
member.summary: The icon indicates a shortcut. However, the icon extractor should not apply the shortcut overlay; that will be done later. Shortcut icons are state-independent.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILIN.GIL_CHECKSHIELD
member.summary: Explicitly return either GIL_SHIELD or GIL_FORCENOSHIELD in pwFlags. Do not block if GIL_ASYNC is set.

member.name: T:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT
member.summary: Defines output options set after getting an icon location.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_NONE
member.summary: No option is defined.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_SIMULATEDOC
member.summary: The calling application should create a document icon using the specified icon.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_PERINSTANCE
member.summary: Each object of this class has its own icon. This flag is used internally by the Shell to handle cases like Setup.exe, where objects with identical names can have different icons. Typical implementations do not require this flag.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_PERCLASS
member.summary: All objects of this class have the same icon. This flag is used internally by the Shell. Typical implementations do not require this flag because the flag implies that an icon handler is not required to resolve the icon on a per-object basis. The recommended method for implementing per-class icons is to register a DefaultIcon for the class.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_NOTFILENAME
member.summary: The location is not a file name/index pair.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_DONTCACHE
member.summary: The physical image bits for this icon are not cached by the calling application.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_ASYNC
member.summary: Set this flag to determine whether the icon should be extracted asynchronously. If the icon can be extracted rapidly, this flag is usually ignored.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_DEFAULTICON
member.summary: Retrieve information about the fallback icon. Fallback icons are usually used while the desired icon is extracted and added to the cache.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_FORSHORTCUT
member.summary: The icon indicates a shortcut. However, the icon extractor should not apply the shortcut overlay; that will be done later. Shortcut icons are state-independent.

member.name: F:ShellBoost.Core.WindowsShell.GILOUT.GIL_SHIELD
member.summary: Windows Vista only. The calling application must stamp the icon with the UAC shield.
